text:
People there are friendly, good varieties shushi.
I was there 12/25 and back on the 26th.
Will come back again.

management should take note; they should have a better system for people waiting to be seated. the main entrance and exit  door is crowded. it's a fire hazard. i'm sitting 1/3 plastic chair they provided but there's like dozen more standing in front of me and there's no clear pathway for people exiting!   i don't think they adhere to the capacity limit of the building. people are in top of each other, the passage way in between tables to go to the buffet is so tight.  been going here for decades now food has been consistent been good.

Went there today for the first time for a group event during lunch. The place was crowded with seating close together, so at times it was difficult to walk between tables, which you have to do to access the buffet. Service was good (drinks were refilled often, dirty dishes cleared frequently, etc...). The food was nothing to write home about.  The hot food was not hot enough, the tempura was soggy, and the sushi rolls did not taste fresh. The pieces of sushi seemed fresh because that seemed to be what was being consumed and therefore turned over quickly. When I got the bill, I noticed the drink was an extra charge, which surprised me because buffets in town include a beverage in the price of the meal. I did not try the desserts, but the green tea ice cream looked good.

Very impressed with the varied assortment of sushi. Surpassed my expectations. A little crowded for a Thursday night, which of course, is a good sign. Great service, clean and bright atmosphere. I'll definitely come back again when in Las Vegas.

Food is average and expensive compare to "Todai" restaurant in the casino trip. (Todai restaurant is closed and it is a best place to eat sushi.) if you eat at "Todai" don't come here because it is nothing near to what you get at Todai.

I think it is just better a bit compare to regular chinese buffet restaurant but the price cost twice. for two at least 70 bucks. I don't think it is worth it.
Pretty decent sushi/ sashimi/ nigiri sushi,decent variety and definitely unbeatable price for a "all you can eat" buffet. Highly recommend it!

The tables are so close together and you get charged if leave lots of food left on your plate and don't eat it. The sushi is good but the meat is to chewy and the fish isn't soft. I just wanted some good seafood. Overall it isn't too bad.

I make it a point to visit Makino every time I'm in Vegas.  It's hands down the best sushi restaurant in the USA.  I typically frown on "buffet" style establishments - but the quantity, quality, freshness, and high turnover of the food makes this place a no-brainer.

As if the sushi wasn't enough - there's lots of salads, soups, and even first class sweets (if you have room...)

Don't miss it!
ZK

Not very impressed at all. First of all the layout was kind of an inconvenient. The place was somewhat big but it was tight just maneuvering around the food bar. 

Sushi rolls: had alot of varieties
Nigiri: it was somewhat warm, not disgusting warm but it could have been better

Everything else was just meh, nothing to rave about and nothing to remember about.

Conclusion: I would never come back unless someone else paid for me.
Love my Makino...everytime I'm in Vegas we alway go there at least once. They are now serving ramen...soo yummy.

Have heard so much about Makino's that I thought I should give it a try... I'm not the biggest fan of sushi.. but I do like it.. and Makino's does a great job. They've got a great selection of sushi. 
But it's not only a sushi restaurant. It's got some other great hot entrées. The tempuras, fried chicken, fish and other items on the buffet are amazingly good...
Overall it's a great dining experience.

Makino is a good example of what high quality Asian buffet should be. Even though their prices r a bit higher than your typical Asian or American. But it is well worth it, if U r a Sushi or Japanese food connoisseur.

Better than Todai
Fresh sushi and the other foods are very edible unlike other Asian buffets where you are afraid to eat them. The price was fair $29.95 for dinner. Every time in Vegas we come here for Japanese buffet.

This is the place!!
i love their  huge selections of sushi . great customer service . I come here at least once a month

I traveled to Vegas on business trip often, last 2 trips in April and May respectively, I went to this restaurant by recommendation from a friend of mine.  Oh, boy, tell you what, it is really good for a seafood Japanese buffet restaurant.  Vegas is the capital of buffet, and I have tried many of them in Vegas or in LA.. Sashimi, sushi, tempura, seaweed roll, crab legs, etc., are all fresh and tasty.  Staff are very friendly.  Although the table is small and always crowded during dinner time (when I went), but they replenish fresh food often, so, you don't need to wait.  Definitely a must go place for me now every time I traveled to Vegas.
There's something here for everyone. Beautifully presented and delicious. Went on a Friday night and we're seated right away. Service was good and food was great. Must return when in Vegas again!

All sea food are fresh and food station is clean.
Waitress services are 5 stars!
I'll come back here whenever visit Vegas again!

Service was friendly and attentive with our drinks. You know the sushi isn't that good when the "preparers" aren't sushi chefs. Trust me, I just know. How do they get away with fake crab meat? Awful. 

There are several AYCE dishes you can choose; from miso soup, odon, tough teriyaki beef, not-so-bad breaded scallops on a stick, bland noodles, tasty garlicy fried rice, oily and too bready shrimp tempura, etc. And all the desserts from their small selection of sweets from cookies, gelatins, fruits and mini cakes that weren't too bad. 

I had to bring Hubby here once just to see if he likey.  He said it was okay.  I forgot how much I truly don't like this place, for crappy sushi with mediocre dishes at $25 pp... "been there, done that" and I don't think we'll be back.
Horrible! Not what I remember it used to be. Stay away. My family got ill from eating here!
a lot of sushi selections.   The service was great! The servers consistently attended to our needs as they picked up finished plates and refilling water when they needed to be.

Lots of sushi variety and fresh fish. The scallop nigiri was buttery smooth. Service was fast and courteous. There was a lot of variety and staff made sure the fish never ran out. For the lunch price, this buffet is definitely worth your money.
this is very recommended!!!!!!! they serve various kind of food and super fantastic dessert. I would definitely come back here again
The food was okay. They had sashimi only for a short time and refused to bring anymore out. It ended up being $65 for two at dinner. I would try something else before coming here again.

We went there with company.  This place feels like a cheap buffet, loud and crowded.  The food is average minus.  I was OK in the morning after, but my wife had a bad stomach.  If it wasn't our company's pick, we would have never went there.
All in all, if you feel like treat your self with good Japanese food for $30.00 per person, there are many better places to choose then this one.
Went here on recommendation. Good for buffet food, but that price mann. Over $30 for a buffet in LV is normal, but I'd rather go to Big Wong or something and get cheap, good food

I don't have much to say about this place, except i expected a lot more.

When I got there with my husband and child, it was pretty packed, we waited about ten minutes for a table that was lliterally 2 inchs away from the next table...
That right there is the first demerit. It felt really uncomfortable to sit that close to someone that I didn't really know.

Next goes to the selection of food, I expected from them to have a sushi selection. They had rolls on one side, nigiri on another. also some other cold plate area. They had oysters as well. Their hot food didn't have a big selection either. But i am giving them and extra star for their ramen, which i didn't expect so that was cool.

Their desserts were so-so. Honestly i don't remember what i had, besides the ice cream, which when i asked for my scoop, and the lady was pretty rude. Ummm If you hate your job, don't let it show. So there goes another demerit.

And the prices for the quality that they put out is a bit overpriced.
Tried it out for the first time, since it was recommend by friends. Although the sushi was just okay it was the ramen that hit the spot.

After I learned that Todai in Planet Hollywood was closed, I decided to give Makino a try.  Very good.  Sushi and sashimi fresh and good.   Very authentic Japanese food, such as fried rice and yakisoba were like I used to eat in Japan.  They also serve ramen.  I tried the Tonkotsu ramen, I would give it a 7 out of 10.  Not as good as Sora and other ramen specialty places, but not bad.  Udon was good, and I added tempura shrimp to it.   The kalubi beef was very tasty.   For dessert the crème brule was one of the best I've eaten.  On the negative side:1)  Shoe cream (Cream Puffs) only had whipped cream inside, not the normal and better tasting whipped cream + vanilla jello.  2) Miso soup machine only put out hot water.   $28 for dinner not bad.  I would come back again.

It's a great place to have sushi and other sides. I highly recommend going in right at opening because all the sushi/food is there when you want it. The place gets packed quickly at opening.We always go during lunch. Worth what I pay.
Parking might suck.

Had a great time here. Went with a large group and when we saw the swift service and the plates of sushi kept coming, I had to leave a review. The atmosphere here is great. being surrounded by food from 3 of the 4 walls is really beautiful. The chefs were smiling the whole time and my friends and I kept the laughs going. There was a slight mix up when we were being seated but it was resolved quickly and the delicious sushi made up for that. Also the location is great, close to the strip. This place is worth a try!

I used to love Todai. Then they closed down where I lived. I found out mr Makino was the founder of Todai so I had to try it when I visited Vegas. The sushi was fresh and overall tasty. I took one star off for the cramped interior that smelled a bit old and was off putting. The price is fair so no complaints there.

Probably the best sushi buffet I've seen outside of Asia! I was going bananas here! Make sure you walk all the way around to see everything! I discovered more sushi around the corner towards the very end! A great variety of salads. Tempura heaven. The dessert was yummy. Would definitely come back and bring friends and family!

4-stars from me. Their selection is vast, the Sushi is great, tastefully prepared and as fresh as it gets in the Mojave Desert. Sure, there can be a wait - that's what happens when a place is popular. Holding back the 5th star wishing the price was lower, but we still go there anyway, just not as often as we'd like.

AMAZING all you can eat sushi, honestly best place I've been since moving out here!! Fresh fresh fresh!! Every roll you can think of and regular sushi, delicious desserts make sure you save room!! Better than these other seafood buffets and a better price! Prices have gone up about a follow from the photo I took but these are photos from pretty much the whole line up at
Lunch today, something for everyone if you love seafood HUGHLY RECOMEND I wish my tummy was bigger I would have had more than three rounds!! Will post second review so I can include all photos! Chocolate fondue and amazing white chocolate raspberry treats everything was good the sushi and calamari I could go all day

Makino's is the ISH!  The best all you can eat sushi place I've ever been to.  The variety is above anybody else around.  There's pretty much every type of food you can think of and for only $25 bucks!!  The buffets at the casinos can't hold a candle to this place.  Anyway I make it a point to visit every time I go to Vegas.  Try to get there early in the cycle.  Get there early lunch time if you are doing lunch or early dinner if you are dinner.  The food is much fresher and tastier.  And be prepared to get stuffed!  Don't eat anything for 24 hours before you go.  Believe me...

I've been to both Makino locations (Irvine and this one) - and to me, this location is the better of the two.  

They have a lot of choices for not only the sushi, but the other non-seafood dishes, and everything seems fresh and tasty.   

Layout is a mixed bag- it's nicer overall, but feels a bit older.  Still a plus, there are some nice cozy seats in here.  

Lots of dessert choices, fresh marinated beef, very efficient service.

Crowded on the weekends with people looking for a change from the strip buffets.  

Parking lot is on the downhill side of Food 4 Less, and their shopping carts will end up at the bottom.  Be watchful of where you park, and have a buffer...
I really enjoyed this place. Good varieties of sushi and other foods. I really like that they have just the tuna, salmon, and octopus without the sushi rice. Really love the place!

I evaluate all the Restaurants based on the cleanliness and atmosphere, Service of Staff, Quality, quantity, taste and presentation of food that proportionate to the price.

Atmosphere -  4 star, nice decor and spacious, little too crowded maybe due to the food is good.

Service of Staff -  5 star, friendly staff and waitress.
Quality and Quantity of food portion for the price - 5 star,  special dessert and good variety of food.

$18.95/person for lunch.
I'm not sure how this place makes money.... Very high quality food, all you can eat, at reasonable prices.  If they only had this restaurant in Seattle!

One of the best buffets EVER. The sushi is like an explosion of flavor. The dessert is the BOMB. They have a variety of good dessert sushi, and many other masterpeices . It is a great place to relax. And your hereing this from a 9 year old who hates vegetables

Came here with friends who highly suggested this place and it was better than any other AYCE Japanese buffet in LV or LA.  Highly recommend this place for anybody visiting Vegas.  Open at 11:30AM but be there at 11 to avoid long lines.
i got the best sushi tho all you can eat! we try this place together with the whole family and it turn out everything is awesome food,service and the facilities!

This is my family's favorite place for sushi buffet, at least for lunch.  We haven't been here for dinner.  As far as lunch, it's better than Todai in selections.  The selections are many, even for desserts like chocolate fondue, ice creams, shave ice, ect.  They are plenty of rolls and sushi to choose.  There are also pretty good selections of cooked stuffs if you're don't want to eat too much of the 'raw' stuffs.  The only thing not available during lunch that my son love is the salmon roe(eggs).   Todai doesn't have that for lunch either.   I can't really comment much on the cooked stuffs since I normally ignored most of them.  I do love the tempura shrimps though.

We've been coming here on and off for years but this is the first time we came here during a holiday.  We went there for dinner during Christmas Eve and for lunch the day prior.  Lunch time yielded a half hour wait.  The sushi, nigiri, and everything else tasted fresh.  

For dinner we thought we'd arrive early to beat the crowd only to find roughly 10 parties already lined up at the side entrance waiting in the windy cold weather at 4:50pm.  To our surprise and delight they opened the doors at 5pm (normal dinner hour starts at 5:30pm) to accommodate everyone.  It's smart on their part because they can squeeze in more customers during dinner service.  Once we got in we enjoyed the salmon and tuna sashimi, as well as crab legs.   

We always had our plates promptly removed and drinks refilled before we asked for them hence the 5 stars.  They were barraged with kids running around spilling things and the staff were on top of things.  We will definitely return.
The most delicious Japanese buffet we had twice a week. After that we came back home to think of it.

This place is packed. The selection is quite a lot, but the fish is okay, not considered great. So, the saying you get what you paid is totally applicable here. Besides sushi, they have cooked food as well as dessert items.

Good foods. Good services.
Many sushi selection, tastes fresh and good too.
Love the fresh baby oyster and the crab, tastes fresh.
Dessert is good too. One of my favorite buffet to go too.
It wouldn't be a successful visit to las Vegas without lunch or dinner at Makino.  The display of sushi is eye candy!  We love the desert bar with the chocolate fountain  to dip fruit or cake.
As this price, it's really good. the food are fresh and a lot of expense seafood for you to choose!
A wide variety of mediocre lukewarm food.   Was very disappointed in the quality of the food.  Even the miso soup was weak & tasteless.

I enjoyed a meal at Makino years ago, so I decided to return on a recent trip.   It was Father's Day (June 16th 2013) so I checked the website to get the hours and prices, and decided to go early to avoid the crowd.  According to the website the Irvine location would be slightly higher priced but they would be offering King crab legs (instead of just snow crab legs), but the Las Vegas locations would have a normal menu and pricing.

I arrived to find a paper sign noting the price was jacked by $2/pp simply because it was Fathers Day, so customers were "bait and switched" at the door.  And no King crab legs.

Since I'm alone I'm seated by the door and hostess/cashier, which is fine for me.  The sushi is good but the tempura sauce tastes weird/bitter, and eventually I start to feel ill.  Having eaten nothing else all day, it could only be the Makino food.  As I get out my credit card to make a quick exit, the waitress rushes over to take it from me, despite the fact that the cashier station is 6 feet in front of me.  

She seems to process my transaction, but then gets into a long chat with the cashier (at least 2 minutes) while I am sitting there feeling worse by the minute.  She finally turns around, realizes that I am staring at her while she ignores her customer, and quickly brings the receipt to me to sign.  Between feeling ill and being annoyed that instead of just paying and going I had to sit through her chat, I did not realize that my credit card was not returned with the bill.

I wisely immediately drove back to my hotel so that I could be near a toilet for a lovely evening of diarrhea, rather than enjoying the sights of Las Vegas with friends as had been planned.

On the drive home to Southern California the next day, I stopped for gas and realized my credit card was gone, last seen at Makino.  After arriving home I called the restaurant and was told "we no keep credit card", but when I insisted that it was definitely there, another female came on the line and admitted they have my credit card.  I asked her to mail it to me, and she responded with "OK!" and hung up... without asking my address!!!

I immediately called back and told her I am now 300 miles away so it will have to be mailed and I can't just come pick it up.  The hostess then starts to argue with me, 'you left the card here', and I replied, "NO, my waitress did not return it with my bill!".  She then said that she would have to have a manager call me back and took my phone number.   I was never called back, and had to report the incident to my bank.  I am also filing a formal complaint against their Visa Merchant account, since they violated the terms of service and acted inappropriately when their error was show to them.

So.... If you enjoy bad service, management that KEEPS your credit card, gouges customers on Fathers' Day, and serves food that causes diarrhea, Makino Decator is the place for you!

I am not  sure how anyone has given this place 3 or 4 stars. Yes they have a good amount of food to choose from, but doesn't any buffet? The hot items were almost warm, and by almost warm I do not mean they were kinda hot, more like kind of room temperature. I love sushi, been to many AYCE sushi places, definitely would not go here for sushi. Unless that is if you think it is ok if you cannot tell the difference between there salmon and there tuna when you close your eyes because all of there fish is either tasteless or fishy, oh and that too is room temperature.
      Pretty sure raw fish sitting out and being served at room temperature is in fact a food safety violation, I am really hoping I do not get sick for being dumb enough to eat the pieces I had on my plate. There rolls were ok they actually had flavor,  mostly due to the sauce however. All those that say this place has good sushi probably are also the same people that call a california roll or some roll with mayonnaise and or cream cheese sushi, they are not. 
     The place was empty at lunch time on a friday, I can taste why that is. The staff I will admit was friendly and service was what you would expect at a buffet, the food however was nothing special. Money not so well spent. Quality lacking, I am really disappointed in yelper on this one, I followed the advice of some people that obviously do not really care what they put in there mouth when I read the reviews on this place. One last comment, in case you did not notice that I really did not care for their "sushi" I should just say that if I was rating only on there sushi I would have given them only 1 star, the second star came in because they have some good appetizer type selections such as the calamari, pickled cucumbers, seaweed salad, udon, kim chee along with some others such as edemame. Sorry to others that have a discriminating pallet as I do and ate here. This is my first review and I am only writing it because I was amazed at how far off the reviews on this place really are.
Outstanding value for you money...Sushi is all fresh...staff is very attentive...selections are beyond what one would expect!!
This review is long over due. Service was fast for drinks and being seated. Probably more decent for an ACE compared to SD. I was hungry so everything seemed good.

Pretty good quality for a buffet.  Good value and selection to choose from. 

 A bit far from the strip and parking can be a hassle but otherwise a pretty good spot

Makino is SOOO much better than Todai! So many selections and the sushi has always been fresh when I went there. I took a lot of my friends there and they've all been impressed, yay! I think it's also better than other all-you-can-eat sushi places because you don't have to finish everything on the plate. I hate places that charge you just because you leave one grain of rice on the plate...

After having passed by the sign of this "great" sushi restaurant at the outlet center, we go only to find out it was closed down. So we decided to drive to the location on Decatur. First off, it smelt soo bad outside of the place so I already didn't have a good feeling. We go inside and its not to bad. People were nice and sat us quickly. It was very busy for a Sunday night. We go up to get our food and I almost immediately think this was a bad idea. None of the sushi was cold. It was room temperature. Sushi, hand rolls, crab legs NOTHING WAS  COLD. I went to take a bite of the yellow tail and I'm not to sure what made me smell it but I did and NO THANK YOU. I was done at that point. My husband (having a tummy to steel) continued on. Almost immediately after leaving he starts saying "my stomach doesn't feel so good" "I think the sushi was bad". So needless to say myself, my husband and my child were sick the entire night. This place sucks. Worst sushi place I have ever tried.

I would choose this Sushi buffet over Todai. They have a lot more unique sushi varieites, the pieces are bigger and tastier. I'm not a huge fan for sushi but I like Makinos. You can tell they use fresh ingredients and their stuff don't sit out too long. But beware Yelpers out there...they have a couple of location and not all are the same. I would stay away from the one at the Premium Outlet....that one was horrible. Totally the opposite from this one on Decatur Blvd. For dinner you get a crab legs and cocktail shrimps. Crab legs aren't bad depending on season. The cooked items may not be a whole lot to choose from like Todai because they mostly focused on the sushi section but overall not a bad selection for the taste. Might have to get there earlier on weekends and holiday because there will be a wait. Definitely make reservation for a larger party.

We were regulars at the Makino Charleston Outlets but just found out they had closed since last December so we drove to the Decatur location. The sushi was fresh but also love the oysters, grilled Salmon colar, baked prawns, steamed Crab legs, Teriyaki Beef, tonkatsu ramen, Shrimp Tempura and many more. Service was fast the staff kept our drinks filled and used plates removed regularly.
By far the best sushi & seafood in Las Vegas! Just located 15 minutes away from the strip. I promise you won't be disappointed!

One of the best Japanese buffets that I've ever been to. They've got a large selection of sushi. They've got a dessert section as well that includes ice cream, cakes, and a chocolate fountain for fruit. They offer shrimp, noodles, orange chicken, soups, and ceviche. Top quality food. The only thing is that it can get quite busy in there and you'll have to sit close to other tables. The waiters are very attentive.

I'm a huge sushi-buffet enthusiast because I'm cheap and I love mass quantities of food, so I was super-excited to head to Makino's $17 lunch buffet. But I was pretty disappointed by the whole experience. 

First, because we'd tried to go to their dinner buffet at 9 pm the previous night, but were turned away because they were taking away the food. But I managed to get a glimpse of a gleaming heap of oysters and crab legs that was decidedly lacking at the lunch buffet. 

Second, because all the rolls were tasteless and bland and seemed to be variations of the same thing. I hate deceit! 

Third, because of their small selection of fresh sashimi -- I love mackerel, but I was sad to see a few paltry pieces in the corner.

The best thing about Makino was the dessert bar's chocolate fountain. Holy shit I had no idea how fabulous a thing a chocolate fountain could be. Bowls of fruit and marshmallows with long sticks and a yum yum yummy chocolate coating. But it kind of pissed me off when they turned it off at 2:30, a half hour before their stated closing time.

All in all, so-so.

Food was ok. Price not bad. But here's what they did when I went there for lunch today. They put your check on the table and when you're done you just go to the cashier and pay. So in the middle of a busy lunch time and the restaurant was packed, the servers started taking all of the checks from all of the tables and later replaced them with different ones. The new ones were about $3 higher than the old ones! When asked why, they said the cashier was new and she was trained wrong. When told that it was bad business to do that, to show a customer the check and then replace it with a more expensive one, they said "sorry" and that was it! BAD BUSINESS! They made the mistake so they should have had the dignity to suck it up and eat the few dollars they lost! Worst part is that there was no sincerity in the apology.

I eat here often because it's across the street from my office and i have never had a bad experience. The sushi is good but not the best. Its acceptable for lunch. The service is always great even with the place always being packed. It has a decent selection and isn't over priced.

Sushi heaven!! The sushi was amazing! I like how the sushi is ready-made so you can pick from a bunch of different rolls to try. I love the cream mussels. Good selection of desserts. The green tea cheesecake was delicious! They have hot food as well and different types of salads. And $18 for lunch is a great price as well.

Great buffet off the strip, especially considering the many many options of sushi along other great Japanese selections. They'll even custom make a roll for you if ya ask them!! The prices are low as well

I loved this place and the service was great!!! We came here at 12pm amd it was packed already and they have a long waiting line... we waited for 30 mins to be sitted but it was worth it.. because the food are great... everything are tasty and delicious... Only thing is that I think they could have put a little more food choices on the buffet line lol... but everything else was great!!! Thanx for the great service!!!

Great place for seafood and meats. I highly recommend the sukiyaki when they have it. Great variety! The only negative is that their ice cream station is never manned. It's a common sight to see people waiting for a while before eventually leaving or going to searching four someone.

Broken Hearted!  Been going to this Makino's every week for over 13 years and loved every experience until lately.  Something's changed and it seems they're going the 'cheap' route.  I've sang the praises of this restaurant to everyone if Sushi comes up and it's been superb until now.  Now it's just okay and far from where it was.  Changed to some type of rice that was dry and had a cheap taste to it, dishes for wasabi have changed to disposable plastic.  Tuna is too red and appears to have color added.  Since when do you put pieces of carrot in sushi rolls unless you're looking for a cheap filler?  Too many rolls have cream cheese.  I like cream chees but should have a slight presence in sushi rolls.  The final straw of 'cheapness' is that they don't even have toothpicks anymore.  Okay when they stopped offering mints but toothpicks are important have little cost effect.  Looks like an end to an era.

OH MY GOD.....What a big disappointment. ...
I've been here 5 times, previously, it was pretty good for the inexpensive sushi buffet. 
Clean, well prepared sushi.. 
actually, I enjoyed a lot before. 
So, We came back here again, I immideletly noticed quality of food wend down SO MUCH.
Now, it's same level as "Todai". Mexican style sushi place. Not a real sushi place.
So bad.... if u like "Todai " then you will enjoy this place...But this will be my last time eating hee. Yucky.......
I like this buffet place than the buffet places on the strip.  Love all the sushi, shrimp tempura, gyoza...   Yum!

Huge variety of sushi, vegetable items, hot food and desserts. Most of it's very good and a great value. Timely and friendly service too.

Main complaint is that the place often gets uncomfortably loud and crowded, feeling more like a cafeteria than a restaurant. Plus the shopping center in general is shady.

If I'm going to eat with friends I might prefer to pay a little more to go somewhere else with a quieter atmosphere and servers, but otherwise this is my #1 designated 'cheat meal' spot. :)
my new favorite!  forget ayce sushi, this is sashimi, seafood, salad, beef, dessert, etc. variety is outstanding.  quality and taste exceptional. great deal for price.

I was very disappointed with the fact that you had to pay $10 difference to get crab legs and the only crab legs that they had were soft mushy saltwater fish in the shell I was very disappointed that I had to pay for my drink separately I live in Vegas and you always get drinks free in a buff a unless you drink alcohol other than that the smile was fine as they passify you on your way out the front door

Japanese food for gluttons. It is all you can eat! The food is good but how much rice can one eat. I always stop at the second plate. That sucks for me. The service is always good at this location. I prefer the dinner menu better because hey have the stuffed jumbo shrimp and oysters. It cost more but it is worth it. I would highly recommend this place to people who are tired of the same old buffet.

A friend of our who frequents LV introduced us to this spot 5 years ago. It satisfied and exceeded expectations then, so when we went back to Vegas last weekend, it was top 3 on my list to do. And boy, was I glad!!! I love it, love it, love it. The sushi is fresh and the selections was huge. The prime rib was perfect with the horseradish and the sauce. The variety was just awesome and anyone would be sure to be satisfied. We even went on Mother's Day and the line was long but the wait was only 10 mins. I am super-satisfied and looking forward to another visit!

I am an avid sushi go-er and have been for the past 10 years that I have lived in Las Vegas. I have tried sushi from the high end places and places that, based on location alone, one would probably never even dare to try. So it's safe to say that I know my sushi and I know when sushi is good....and when it is not good. Today was my boyfriend's birthday and he is also a sushi lover. I was trying to surprise him with somewhere new because for a while now we have gone to the same sushi place (because we KNOW it is good) and I stumbled upon this place Makino while searching for top all-you-can-eat-sushi in Las Vegas that also didn't break my bank account. I chose Makino for its high review ratings and because they offered a wide range of desserts unlike most other all--you-can-eat sushi restaurants that only offer a few (my boyfriend loves desserts and I wanted him to have a wide selection on his birthday, but most sushi places only offer a few desserts). 

Upon walking in, I must say that I was quite ecstatic; honestly from the entrance you can't see much except the dessert section and boy did those desserts look good. I was proud of myself when I looked up at my boyfriend's face and saw that he too looked very excited by the dessert table ( we both have sweet tooths); However, the gleeful period did not last long. As soon as were seated we headed to the sushi section and low and behold an array of sushi. Based on appearance, I was expecting the sushi to taste wonderful because it all looked so pretty. What initially bothered me though was that there was no way to tell what each roll consisted of. There were no labels at all above the sushi that told me what was inside of each roll so I selected based upon appearance alone. The first roll that I tasted actually tasted pretty good. It was a bit warmer than I would have preferred my sushi but it was still pleasant. I jumped into the next bit of sushi on my plate thinking it'd be just as good, but that wasn't the case. My mouth immediately became overwhelmed with fishiness (not the good subtle kind, but the kind when fish is spoiled) and I tried to swallow it down but it was so strong that I had to spit it into my napkin. On top of that being embarrassing since my boyfriend was right next to me, I was not eager at all to try anymore of the sushi; however, I did try one more piece just to see if maybe it was a one time deal, but nope. The next piece I put it in mouth had some type of fish in it that was so blatantly dry that it was tough to swallow without choking down water as well. 

I was disappointed to say the least because the main reason I went there was for the sushi because we both love sushi so much, but when I looked over at my boyfriend's plate he had hardly touched his sushi (and he NEVER lets food go to waste, especially sushi). Even though the sushi was pretty bad, we moved on to the other food. Crab legs, clams, fried rice, even chow mein; we tried pretty much everything there because we were hungry and figured that maybe it was just the sushi that was bad. But no. It wasn't just the sushi. I stacked my plate with chow mein, clams, calamari, fried rice, salmon, vegetables tempura etc.; The ONLY thing that I thought tasted good was the vegetables tempura (and if that had been bad I would have been amazed because it's pretty hard to make something fried taste bad). The clams were mushy liked they'd been overcooked, the fried rice seemed to have no flavor besides the oil it was cooked in, and the same with the chow mein. 

Lastly, we gave Makino one last chance; one last chance to impress us and we hoped badly that at least the yummy looking desserts would be delicious. We both tried all of the desserts and while they weren't incredible, they weren't bad either. The textures on most of them were odd, not creamy as they appeared but rather more jello like, but neither of us minded that because they tasted good. The cookies were all fairly good, and the chocolate mousse was the one that impressed me. 

All in all if someone asked me if I would recommend this place I would say absolutely not. The only reason I even gave it two stars was one for the ambiance because the place was relaxed, even for a buffet, and the other star goes to the chocolate mousse. I'm usually not this critical and actually never leave reviews but I felt it was necessary this time because I do not think this place is at all worth the $60 I spent ($27.99 per person + tax). I hope if you try it you have a better experience and that maybe my boyfriend and I just went on a bad day.

This place is expensive but seems worth it for the most part. The sushi is very diverse and there are a bunch of options that I haven't seen in other sushi buffet restaurants.

I'm not sure how to compare it to other sushi buffet restaurants since if you've been going to other ones like Todai for a while now like me and have gotten tired of the same old stuff then this place is a great place to try something different.

However, I only went here once and had a good experience but wouldn't necessarily recommend going to this place or any sushi buffet restaurant all the time.

I have been going to Makino for several years now. I used to go at least four to eight times a month during this time. Over time I realized I have been going quite a bit less but couldn't put my finger on why. 

Today I went again. I got my plate and when I went to get sushi, there were three mexican sushi chefs loudly carrying on a conversation in spanish. OK, I get that times are tough and the first rate sushi places get the real Japanese chefs. But do you have to alienate your customers with something this out of place in a sushi restaurant? 

I then noticed the jalapeño slices on the sushi. WHAT??? Is this some kind of odd mexican fusion restaurant now? I then noticed the talipia. OK, so this place is no longer a sushi place. 

I went into full on restaurant food critic mode. The salads were not tasty and were poorly made. The hand rolls had canned tuna in them. The soups were just sad. I saw a few things that made me question their food sanitation. 

Makino is on a down hill slide and I will not be going back. I gave them 2 stars because the food is still edible, but for 20+ dollars, it is not worth it.

It's got quantity. Quality not so much. Pretty much expected as a chinese sushi buffet. Sushi doesn't look fresh and most other stuff are just filler foods (rice and carbs). You will get full, but don't go expecting much.

Had lunch with the family this afternoon. Great Food selections, fresh sushi (Tuna, Salmon, Mackerel, Scallop..etc..) Fried Tempura, Fried and steamed rice, good line up of desserts. AYCE (buffet) so you'll leave the place full.

Servers are friendly and attentive. They always check it you need drink refills. 5 star for service.

Definitely a place to visit.

Came here on a whim.  Decent for the price but first of all, they wouldn't let me take photos.  Automatically they get one star only for lack of accountability for their food and reviews.  Remove your Yelp account as a restaurant if you don't want customer photos.  "Clean" Plates dirty and greasy.  Bacon dish had raw bacon.  Spicy tuna was seemingly put into blender.. gross.

I love coming here for lunch whenever I'm in town. The fish is fresh and the hot line is amazing. The desserts are also on point with a variety of Asian flavored ice creams such as Green Tea and Red Bean. Gotta love it
Lots of delicious selection. Pork ramen was simple amazing, I just had to had two bowls
Excellent quality and good price ($17) for lunch. The NY teriyaki was super tender.

Go to place for sushi! If you want shrimp tempura, it is an all you can eat kind of restaurant! I've eaten and all you can eat restaurants before stumbling on Makino's and hands down Makino's is the winner! We absolutely love coming to Vegas for our sushi fix and always leave satisfied!

One of the best sushi buffet around in the west coast. We were in Vegas for a combo birthday & bachelor's party during Sept. 11th weekend. On our first night arriving in Vegas after 4 hours drive from LA, we headed to Makino with high recommendations from local Vegas friends. 

Their all-you-can eat seafood selections include sea bass, grilled salmon, calamari steak, and baked clams. Their spicy tuna, salmon & rainbow rolls were da bomb. 

And for the sweet tooth desserts, they have chocolate & strawberry mousses, fresh fruits, and lots of assorted cakes.

If you are in Vegas and like Japanese and asian fusion food, gotta try out Makino. And it's relatively cheaper priced compared to the hotel/casino buffet counting to spend around $25-26 for dinner or $16-17 for lunch.

Two of my friends and I headed to Makino after a long day at the pool, very hungry and very excited for "all you can eat sushi" - willing to pay a hefty $30 each.

We ordered our plates and set out to the buffet.  The diversity of dishes was good, but the selection of rolls, Sushi, and Sashimi was limited.  We loaded up our plates and sat down to eat.  

The first comment that came out of my friends mouth was that her sashimi was lukewarm - like, sat out for a while warm.  We kept eating and each bite was as unexciting as the last.  No good flavors, weird, congealed textures - it all just seemed unfresh - not something you usually expect - especially for $30 a head.

Disappointed, we stopped eating before we had finished our first plates and tried to think of how we should proceed.  None of us wanted to keep eating, but felt that we had invested far too much to not get a good meal.  Finally, I decided to call the waitress over and very politely let her know that we didn't like our food.

She went away and spoke to her manager (who i found out was the owner) and told me there was nothing she could do.  I persisted and she brought him over.  He told me that there was nothing he could do because I had started eating the food (well duh- how would I know it was bad).  He then claimed that I must not like sushi (the moment when I was glad I was sitting with two Asian girls).  Finally he told me he would remove one of our meals from the bill. So - eventually we paid $60 for three people to eat a few scraps of food.  

I wouldn't recommend this place - warm, congealed sushi for $30 a person.
My family's favorite buffet. Good selection of ready made sushi. Crab legs and other entrées. Desserts to satisfy your sweet tooth and friendly staff....
We went out family couple of  days ago and I was so disappoint.   Crap wasn't fresh.  Guess what we are not going back to that place again.
I have been to this place countless time with friends and family, best food for your money, clean busy place , courteous employees , great drink menu, hot sake's to die for

My first time eating here! My dad was craving Japanese and I was looking places to eat in Vegas because we're from San Francisco and I been to Vegas couple times but for my parents first and second time in Las Vegas. This place is awesome despite the long wait to be seated but it was dinner time. If your bring your parents who are age 65 and above they get 25% discount during dinner time. Great place would love to come back again

The food was OK, it was kind of slow so the fishes was sitting on the open air buffet for to long essentially starting to look like jerky. The selection was also very limited, I asked the sushi chef to make me nigiri salmon with slices of lemon and he looked at me like I had an arm growing out of my head. The price was 25.99 plus 1.95 drink, so in my opinion it was very pricy for what it was...SUSHI BUFFET... I don't think I will be coming back here the food just was not as fresh as your standard sushi restaurant, especially for the price. 

Also the service was not all that great, drinks at our table were empty more of the time then full.
Very decent price for the quality of food. Assortment of rolls and a decent array of sushi. If you're Asian you'll get your fix.

Nasty nasty nasty.   Quality of food is so low I don't even know it's legal .  If you walk out without parasitic infection , you are lucky.
Service is actually friendly but it has to be lowest quality allowed for sushi.

Went for Sunday brunch. Tons of fresh food and lots of options. Main issue was sushi was not labeled. It was all tasty but I'd like to know what I'm eating!!! Dumplings were good as were the tempura veggies.
The key is to come only during lunch right before they open, then you get the freshest sushi. Duh?

I don't understand some of the bad reviews I've seen. I enjoyed everything from the sushi, hot food, to desserts during lunch time. If you go on an empty stomach, eat some of the hot food first then attack the sushi. Perhaps a bit pricey, but worth it.

My parents love this place. It's a Japanese buffet restaurant but it's not the usual "Everyman for himself" type of experience that one is accustomed to in all you can eat places (especially with seafood).  We love it here because the service is great and the people who come are "cool" and considerate. Almost endless variety of sushi and salads with many delicious entrees.  If you are allergic to lobster and crab like me, don't worry because you will still have many mouth-watering choices. Now, the dessert, besides the chocolate fountain (which the kids love), there are many, melt in your mouth delectable sweets that will be the perfect end to a perfect meal (unless you're my mom who ends her meal with udon)

My family loves going to this place and come here at least monthly. I think the place is average.  I like their salmon and salmon skins.  They also make fresh handrolls with your selection of fish.  Selection includes soft shell crab for dinner.  The rolls they create are a little strange. I wish they would add signs so we would know what they are.  Their cooked food section is pretty good but use to be better. Bring back your chicken wings please!  Decent selection for desserts.  My favorite is the red bean ice creme.

First time at Makino's was really worth it. Unlike other AYCE sushi places, this doesn't have a limit on how much you can get. Also, there were other choices like calamari (personal fav of the day) & tempura. OMG and their chocolate fountain and green tea ice cream.

If you're a sucker for sushi at a decent price, this fo' sho' is the place to go.

This is my 9 times visit. They used do really good for the food. It's late 8pm night when we come in. The Food are not fresh at all. The crab leg, they make sure you can't eat a lot. They put 1 lbs of salt and msg into every 1 lbs crab leg. Very unethical business. When I go home I have to drink 2 gallon of water. When I wake up I feel sick. Upset stomach. The only good things is the waitress feel guilty for that. I will Never come back again.

I have been going to this place for more than 10 years. Like this place a lot. Most of All you can eat places tell you not to waste any rice and try to charge you for the wasted food. This place is not nosy like other all you can eat places. All waitresses are very nice and professional. I will definitely recommend this sushi buffet to anyone.
i wasn't expecting that the place will be that nasty on new years day. A lot of customers and yet somebody should control the line and the mess in each counter.

If you asked me to name 3 good things and 3 bad things, here's my experience:

The goods, (1) Sushi was fantastic. The detailed presentation, precise cuts, use of colors and tight hand rolls adds sophistication. The sauces complement the sushi rolls and the garnishes adds "brightness" (a cheffy term) to the overall sushi. I've never seen so much variety and creativity in a presentation. (2) The fresh soups are prepared for you "live", just say what type of soup and they'll mix & match garnishes and veggies. The broth was nice and hot, full of flavor and quite savory. The garnishes adds freshness and crunch to the soup. (3) The variety of baked fish adds a nice warm component to the menu, all well-seasoned.

The bads, (1) the sashimi was okay. Seemed a bit dry and lacking of taste (my cousin went as far as saying it tasted processed/manufactured). I do believe they're fresh but not as juicy as other sashimi places. (2) some of the meat dishes were dry and overly looked, especially the medallion with bacon wrapped. My dad's medallion was super dry, he said. (3) I wish they had more fruit variety in the desserts section. Some of the strawberries and grapes were over-ripped. 

Service was also great, wait staff very attentive and cleared our plates quick. My mom asked them 4 separate times to take pictures of our party (I felt embarrassed about that, but my mom insisted). Refilled water and hot tea/coffee non stop. Prices $$ are just right for this quality. By the way, it was raining and the roof was leaking! They put 5 buckets to catch the water. 

Overall it was a nice experience, delicious sushi and courteous staff. I would recommend this restaurant to my guests.

A decent Japanese buffet with a variety of sushi, rolls, and noodle dishes like Udon and Ramen. Everything is fresh. PRICEY. $$$$$ Prepare to spend $30+ for Lunch. Depends on which day of the week you go.
Very good selection or seafood and other meats. The mac and cheese I would skip. Great dessert bar with everything you would want in sweets. I would go back!

Let me preface first by saying that while the food quality is not exactly 4 stars, the place gets 4 stars for overall bang for your buck (lunch buffet $16). 

I came here for  lunch with friends  to find  it is an Asian buffet.
The establishment has been in Vegas for years with several locations all over the valley, some of which have closed due to the economy I bet...

On the buffet menu is everything from decent sushi rolls (bit too much rice though) , to udon, fish, suki yaki beef,  tempura, teriyaki chicken, salads, and more. 
There is also a dessert buffet: red bean/green tea ice cream, pies, cakes, and a chocolate fountain. 

The place was clean, food was presented well. Only major complaint I had was the bathroom. They either need to air it out or get some air freshener that makes the trip more pleasant. 

Other than that, I can see myself coming back in the future with the 'rents/family.

Made my first visit to Makino this past 4th of July week in vegas.  I have to admit, i did enjoy the food, but... here what made my visit so horrible.
After a long drive out to Grand Canyon and back.  We made it to Makino's quite late.  We got there by 8:50pm.  We did call ahead of time and they indicated they closed at 9:30pm.  So we figured,  Ok we can eat till 9:30, which gives us about 40 minutes.  WRONG.  

We got out table started eating.  at 9:10pm, they started removing everything.. and i mean everything.  I was thinking, WTF???? They're business hour sign says close at 9:30pm.. which means, customer's can actually come in up to 9:30pm, right?  

After our second plate, that was it.. other than a few left over plates they were wanting the remaining customer's to clean out.  They litterally started cleaning everything out, while there were still a lot of customer's still eating.  I would say about 10~12 table of customers still eating.  By 9:20pm, almost all the food was gone (as in the worker's cleaned it out), and even the desserts were all stacked up on a cart.. My buddy and i almost felt as we were burdening them to ask for a scoop of ice cream for dessert.  

This is ridiculous... I dont know if the owner's are aware of this practice?
But i think if you're charging your customers the full dinner prices of $26.00 or so.. despite the fact the workers may want to hurry up and go home.. or maybe try and catch the late poker tournament... but if you're business hours says close at 9:30pm..  and you have customer's eating, getting rid of all the food and pretty much pressuring your customers to hurry up and eat and leave by 9:30pm.. is very poor business practice.

They should've at least advice us at 8:50pm, that all the foods will be removed for closing by 9:10pm.. Rather than just charging us the full price, and then pretty much rushing us out of there.

In a city where there's full of buffets, good restuarants.. I have to admit, the food was not bad.  Todai quality... or maybe a tad bit better.. but very bad business practice.  So if you're planning to hit Makino's somewhat late.. dont forget to immediately get about 3 plates full of stuff you want...

Food is just good, Maintained high quality standards. Just better than any other sushi buffet I have been to. Servers are really nice. Price is just right. I wish we have this in los angeles, I would eat here twice a week if we have one.

This is the best, most fresh sushi buffet I've encountered. It's off the Vegas strip but not that far. I've been here twice and still crave it everytime I visit Sin City! The buffet is great and if you're still looking for more, like specific hand rolls, just ask the sushi chefs and they'll make it for you. They're extemely generous with it too - my salmon hand roll was filled with salmon and spilling salmon. I was overwhelmed.
Go there during Luch time. Fewer people, still have a great quality of food!!!

Perhaps 3.5 rather than 4.

I've eaten here a few times as well as the one at the Premium Outlets & I can say I favor Decatur more.

Been here both lunch and dinner. Selection is more extensive than the Outlet location. Same food but more to choose from. Sushi and entrees are delicious, from seafood to meats to soups and rice. Always warm and they're very quick to replace something.

Dessert could be better though. I mean quality over quantity but I'd love to have more choices to choose from rather than just ice cream or fruit or 2 kinds of cake.

I'm a fan though, price is comparable to some AYCE sushi joints, but with Makino you get that plus more!

Buffet style with a lot of sushi and more...poor quality food...seating tight...bathrooms smelly and Asian comfortable...if you got friends that aren't really your friends...great place! No lobby, wait outside and very cold this time of year...parking is terrible...place is no big deal, third time here in 25 years...
Best buffet in town just fantastic been going for years. Price is also great 20 bucks for lunch , great deserts .

Not sure how I feel about this place anymore. This used to be my and the hubbys favorite buffet, but we used to go to the one located at the outlet. At any rate, we loved coming here...until now. The food used to be AMAZING, but something changed and now the food is mediocre. 

The service is good, even on super busy weekend nights. The waitresses try their hardest and don't give attitude, which is a major plus because I don't do too well with attitude lugging people. 

3 stars simply because the food hasn't been the best the last 2 times we came, but will definitely stay in rotation on our list of buffets to dine at.

Very Disappointing. Shrimp Tempura was extremely doughy and cream puff filling was spoiled. It tasted very sour and bitter. Noodles were good and sushi was not great: they could do better. Dessert was decent. If there was a 2 and a half I would give them that. I was very disappointed
Makino at Las Vegas Outlet was very good but this one is not like it. small place and pack of people. the table is so near together, you have to watch out people in and out every time.
Spice ramen is very yummy ... Very rare for a buffet... Everything is good and tasty ... Good place to eat

We usually come here several times a year when we don't want to go to the ayce sushi bars.  This last visit convinced me that this place really is going downhill and it will be a good long while before I come back.

Service is adequate, but the food is sorely lacking.  In the past, I have noticed that the nigiri sushi is not being filled regularly even though the "sushi chef"  is standing right behind the empty plate looking at it for what seems a good 10-min on the lunch rush.  

Yesterday, my wife and I noticed that the rice on nigiri sushi seems to have gotten a bit bigger, while the fish is now paper thin.

They also had a soup called "beef soup."  It was very spicy and the taste was not pleasant.  It looked like something that their Hispanic "chefs" put together and set out on the buffet line.  There was nothing Japanese about that soup whatsoever and after a few sips we stopped eating this altogether.

Also, putting the wasabi into squirt bottles was just a bad idea.  You could tell peoples frustrations of trying to get the wasabi to come out.

Are they on a cost cutting measure?  Who knows.  I will stick to the ayce sushi bars from now on.

Ok, I don't see how people give this place 4-5 star since the food is not good at all. I would pay 4 extra dollar and go to Sushi Mon. Although their all you can eat menu doesn't has sashimi but their sushi, cutroll/hand roll and other items are MUCH better. Just go try it before you bash me.

I LOVE seafood and sushi and this place has a variety to offer. Their shrimp tempura is really good (my fave!) and my hubby and I always order their spicy shoyu ramen (must try). Kids LOVE their home made strawberry ice cream, their green tea ice cream is a must try as well. Desserts section also has a variety of choices for your sweet tooth- you'll be sorry to skip these palatable goodness! This place is always packed  especially over the weekend though, and there's limited parking space. Other than that, 5 stars, for good food, good service and a satisfied tummy. :)

OMG! I'M IN LOVED! Best sushi seafood buffet ever had. All the sushi rolls were perfectly made, not too thick on the rice, perfect proportion. Squid, Octopus, Eel and Conch Nigiri. All the sushi was fresh made and well stocked. Make your own Udon noodle soup. Hot entrees include giant whole steam shrimp that was out of this world. Oh yeah, red bean ice cream. And this was all lunch, loved to see what they have for dinner. Yes! Definitely be back.

My husband and I came here to celebrate his aunt's Bday while visiting them in Vegas. It is an all-you-can eat seafood buffet a few minutes away from the strip. We thought this place was okay. They had a lot of seafood options (including crab legs, shrimp tempura, fried oysters), but not overwhelming (which sometimes can be a good thing). Their crab legs are served with warm melted butter, but the crab legs are cold, not steamed. They did, however, have a pretty good selection of sushi assortments. Lots and lots of different kinds of rolls. 

Not too many sashimi choices though. We are big salmon sashimi lovers, and they did not have any :(  They had some salmon sushi, however the salmon slices were a little on the thin side.

Good selection of desserts including ice cream (green tea, chocolate, vanilla etc; which you can get in a cone and take to go), creme brûlée, chocolate fountain (but no strawberries to dip), creme puffs, and other little cakes. This place was okay, but we have definitely been to better buffet places. If you are looking for a decent buffet that is not as expensive as those on the strip (and if you don't mind driving a few minutes away from the strip), this place may be worth trying. I wouldn't go out of my way though.

Makino has two places in Las Vegas. The main place is on about 4 miles away from the Strip but it is worth to visit. Wide menus entertain guests. I am a Japanese from Tokyo and was impressed in its quality of foods.

Fresh sushi, all you can eat, and the turnover is so quick that the sushi doesn't  sit around and get stale. Lots of choices and varieties, but I would stay away from the hot food as it wasn't as fresh. Little pricey at $20    per person but the food is good for the price.

Honestly they probably deserve 2 stars, however the mean average is doing a serious disservice to anybody with taste.  We drove by this place, checked the Yelp reviews on a whim, and boy have Yelper's missed the mark on this place.

One thing they have correct is that it is significantly better than Todai.  However, even the hot selections and dessert buffet couldn't save this place.  The fish was all chewy and old tasting, and the place was PACKED (we stopped in on Christmas Eve).  Those don't add up; the plates were being constantly swapped out, there should have been some decent nigiri choices, but literally every piece of nigiri was a chore to chew and swallow.  Usually, I love the fish and want to leave the rice-- but here I was tempted to leave the fish and just eat the pretty decent sushi rice.  I will say the sushi is far better than any other buffet line sushi I've ever had, but the Yelper's made it seem like better quality could be expected.  In the end, it's still buffet line sushi-- Sushi lovers don't be conned!

The price point is wrong too.  Lunch may be a decent value, but there are far better hot asian buffets in town for the hot foods at a much cheaper price, and for the same price I can name at least a half a dozen absolutely primo quality AYCE cooked/prepared to order sushi places (actually; with this place clocking in at $25.99 most of the better places are even a few bucks less).  There's really no winning stategy here-- They have decent crab legs, but if it's crab you want there are much cheaper places. And the sushi is borderline gross.  

Heck, if you want crab, for a few bucks more you can ditch the snowcrab and crackers and head over to the Wynn or Bellagio where the crab is King Crab, and the work is already done for you.  On the westside, headout a few more blocks until you get to Hikari, where they will beat every dish served at this buffet for roughly the same price (or less if you are a good looking lady after 11 pm).  And Hikari isn't even the best alternative.

If you like sushi, don't waste your money here and go to a real sushi bar.  One Yelper writes: "One of the best sushi buffet around in the west coast."  The sad thing is they may be right.

For what it's worth, the last time I went to Makino it merited 4-5 stars. Good food abound, with high end items like oysters and crab legs.

I worry about where this place will be when I visit Vegas again as I really liked it! So I'm hoping my review will be a one-off rather than the norm.

We came in looking for the oysters we'd scarfed down in the past, but to my dismay they were replaced by fried oysters which were too much, too greasy for my taste. The crab legs were still present, thankfully, and if you're looking for your fix there -- well, Makino's still got it.

Sushi was good, but I'm a strategic guy when it comes to buffets. Don't want that rice to fill up my belly! Nevertheless there were a couple that I tried that I was happy with. My rule with this area: if it looks good... Go for it.

I pretty much stuck with the crab legs and ventured out into some other unmemorable items. Miso soup & kebabs to name a few. Biggest disappointment was with the green tea ice cream at the end, as it was super bland. Here's hoping that if we end up back here it's back to its glory days.

Love the seafood salad most, not to mention the sashimi and the udon bar...oh, make it everything! I always eat too much when I go to this place. I only wish it wasn't so cramped - I guess they have to squeeze a table in every little space because of the dozens of patrons that line up even before they are open!  It's probably also the reason why sometimes you come upon an almost empty dish offering because there are so many people they can hardly keep up with it.

We have been here twice.  On the first trip, it was very good; however, with our second experience, the quality of food was a bit down... kinda disappointing.

In general, this restaurant is located in the Food 4 Less shopping complex on Decatur.  Parking in the area is a bit cramped.  Both times, we had to park farther away than expected.

The restaurant is laid out with buffet style - cart tables that are located on the far wall of the restaurant.  Tables are nicely spaced out.

Our waitress was very good.  She took care of us and kept an eye on us the whole time.

Now the food:
a.  Salad -- it is okay.  sometimes it is fresh; however, some of the greens are a bit old.
b.  Oyster -- this was our hit and miss.  I love oysters.  During our first trip, oysters were plump, juicy, and fresh.  yay!!!  On our second trip, it was not too fresh at all... small and not appealing
c.  Snow crab legs -- extremely disappointing.   Did they happen to buy anorexic Snow Crabs?  These things were frail and thin... Honestly, both trips, I was a bit shocked.  Being a seafood lover, I was sadly disappointed.
d.  Sushi -- this is why you are here.  They have a good assortment of sushi to choose from.  I prefer sushi with "eel" in it.  Unfortunately, there is not much of a selection (they have only like 2-3 eel dishes).  Overall, the sushi is fresh, it is good as well.

In summary, I took the average of both my visits and came to a 3 star.  Maybe, 3.25 is more fitting.  For 25 bucks a person, I would prefer some other places though.... I would recommend instead:

-- If you like crab legs, hands down, go to Asia Buffet off of Eastern Avenue for only like 19.99 on Fri or Sat -- these things are plump there.  Also, oysters are amazing.
-- If you like sushi, this place is fine.  However, the better place is Sushi-mon (corner of Maryland and Silverado)~ 27 bucks per person.

Cheers and good dining!

The Service was great on Father's Day.  The wait staff cleaned the table often and kept refilling the drinks as needed. The sushi was ok and the handrolls was made for eating and not for presentation.  The hot food selection was very decent and yummy for a buffet.  I enjoyed the Dungeness crabs, thats what I live for at a buffet lol.  The dessert was good but not spectacular.  They did have quite a few selections of ice cream.  Good deal for 33$ on Father's Day.

Been here twice! Pigged out both times for like 2 hrs! This place is hella good. Check em out if you like Asian food!! Chinese, Japanese, and Vietnamese to name a few dishes were all excellent! They get packed quick, that's cuz their food selection is plentiful and very delicious!

The challenge lies within blending food quality with good service at most buffets. Our experience embodied a great deal of both which is why 4 stars is more appropriate than three. Why not five stars, you may ask? Well, five stars is only reserved for those who maximize quality of taste and substance of experience. Although quality was incredible with almost every dish, there's always room for improvement to earn that extra star. However, this is one buffet, of hundreds, that you must come to visit when you are in Vegas.

I always look forward to this buffet when I'm in Vegas.  Great variety in sushi.  Love the freshly made udon.  It's a little cramped and was hard to maneuver a wheelchair but other than our large party having to be separated clear across the room the food didn't disappoint.

Not entirely too sure what all the hype is about for Makino.  Went here during Thanksgiving and even though my party of 3 got there at 5pm (when the restaurant opened at 5), we had to wait an hour because the restaurant first opened its doors for reservations, aka parties of 6 or more.  Maybe it was because we had to wait in the cold for an hour but food was pretty standard of an Asian buffet with some redeemable qualities.  

Ramen was kind of tasty.
Miso soup dispenser.

I know its weird to get miso soup from a dispenser but I am a miso soup fiend and I hate asking my server the sixth time for another helping of miso soup.  So at least I can continue to keep getting more so I won't feel as bad when I get my 15th bowl of soup.  For that reason alone, I bumped up this review to a 4.

It is what it is, dont know why in the hell this didnt finish posting. Hell its been too long to rememeber the specifics about this place and too long since I been back. But I LOVE sushi & if I took the time to review it, then it must be great. Cuz I'm not one to mince words about viddles !!!

This place is soooo good. Lots to choose from. Love the nigiri and the hand rolls. They also have a lot of other food choices besides sushi. Beef teriyaki, mussels and the beef sukiyaki are some of my faves. The food is always fresh and their service is great.
Decent place to get some all you eat sushi. Price is moderate and I have no complaints regarding service. Only thing they could improve on is their dessert selection.

While in Las Vegas my parents brought my cousin and I to this restaurant.  There was a line out the door 1 hour before they were opened for lunch.  It must be good then.   Well when we we're finically seated.  I had to take pictures before all the people headed to the food.  Their buffet spread was amazing and colorfull.   I enjoyed the salad bar so much.  The lively color attracted you like a butterfly on beautiful flowers.   The sushi array was very nice and their were so many choices.  This place is a must for Las Vegas.  It's not on the strip but a hidden gem.  

Stars 
1 star for food 
1 star for facilities
1 star for service. 
1 star for overall experience. 
-star for restrooms. (Did not visit).

Traveling through the area on a road trip and stopped here on a Saturday night. Each person is $35 for the dinner buffet. There are no posted prices and their website doesn't have it posted either so just a warning. The food itself was good but not worth the price. For $5 more you can go to the Bellagio and get waaaaay better food, service, and environment. If you want to avoid the strip but still want to pay strip prices, this is the place for you. The desserts here were just alright. The sushi was *mostly* fresh. Avocado was browning and looked unappetizing and the salmon and tuna used for "special" rolls did not look very fresh. I don't recommend this place, but if you really need to eat a lot and want to avoid the strip be prepared to pay.

I've been coming to Makino for the last couple of years. I had dinner there the other night and it feels like the quality of the food has gone down. Now granted, I understand that quality is lower at buffets, but for the price (which I think went up) didn't seem worth it. The sushi was okay not great, and the crab legs were soggy. The deserts were pretty good but some items were still frozen. I will give Makino another try sometime in the future, but for the price I don't plan on going regularly

So.. for a sushi buffet - it is fairly good. Decent selection and the fish all seemed fresh and of decent quality. Keep in mind however, it is still a buffet so you will get better sushi at a mediocre sushi restaurant if you pick the right dishes.

Fresh sushi and hot seafood.
When i come in vegas my favorite restaurant.
I will recommend all my friend and family
Do not come here unless you want food poisoning or diarrhea. My BF and I came to celebrate with family and left with a stomach infection!

this is obviously a high volume ayce place. 

i've been to others that fit the description and this place falls incredibly short

the crab legs might as well be toothpicks.. the rolls are basically using the leftovers..

there isnt enough substance such as grilled entrees, soup or a carving/mko bar

Outstanding sushi, nigiri, hand rolls, sashimi, oyster, crab legs! I have never been to an asain buffet with this many diverse sushi rolls and nigiri choices. The desserts aren't very good. The cheesecake wasn't rich enough, the green tea cake was great but the bean filing was too chunky. Asain places never seem to get dessert right so I wasn't surprised.

A lot of food. Not too expensive during lunch time. There is also a lone of variety of sushi an hot foods. The taste is good and seafood is fresh enough to not give you a stomach problem. seating is like a big buffet

A good buffet in Las Vegas. There are so many good ones but this one is all Japanese food. Great selection of sushi and cut rolls. There is udon, tempura, miso soup, sukiyaki, tonkatsu, chicken teriyaki, chow mien and fried rice.  There is a good selection of desserts and a chocolate fountain. You can even get an ice cream cone. 
Service is good and fast with a smile! 
I never leave Vegas without eating here at least once! Worth the price.

My friends and I were looking for a new place to try in Vegas, so on a whim, we asked one of our cab drivers if he had any recommendations. After all, most of our best recommendations for places to eat in Vegas have come from locals. He said if we like sushi (and we love it), we should try Makino!

I'm always a little wary of sushi buffets because let's face it, raw fish that's left out for a while... not the most appetizing thing. But I was pleasantly surprised by my trip to Makino-- I think we all were! 

I can see why there may be negative reviews, but for us, the sushi and sashimi were refreshed regularly (thank goodness!) and was really quite delicious. They had a good mix of sushi and non-sushi items, which was good for the members of our party who were not as big sushi fans as the rest of us were. They have an udon noodle station, and really scrumptious mussels!

And even though this place is AYCE sushi, I have to talk about the desserts. Chocolate fondue fountain? Green tea ice cream? And fresh fruit (I am a fruit monster)? Love. The green tea ice cream is super yums, though the annoying thing is you have to wait for someone to get it for you, so try and go when there's no line.

Location-wise, it's sort of off the strip, but we could see the sign for it from our room at Palms Place, so if you're staying at the Palms, definitely go check it out!

tl;dr: Surprisingly yummy AYCE sushi/sashimi! We were all really full, and really pleased. Also, no one in our party of 12 got sick.
What great food for a great value. My wife wanted sushi and Julie wanted crab legs and this place delivered both. Get off the strip and come try this place out. Excellent food for the money.
I've been here about 15 times.  A few times it missed, but otherwise it's fantastic.  Great food, decent prices, and good staffing.

This is a Asian style buffet with a wide variety of sushi selections.  Meats, not much of a variety, however, seafood---tons! I'll give them that, it is a seafood buffet.  The ramen is soooo good! Very congested seating and loud which is typical for buffet restaurants in my opinion.  I did enjoy what I picked out to eat and overall,  I am pleased with the establishment.

Here we go! Sushi/seafood buffet off the strip. $28/person at dinner. 

Food quality here is average, especially considering it's a sushi buffet. The fish all tasted fresh and you can even have made to order hand rolls. The downside is there isn't much creativity with the cut rolls, but they do have all the basics and then some. In regards to regular food, there's all the typical items..chicken yakitori, chow mein, fried rice, shrimp tempura, etc. i wasn't a big fan of the cooked food because it tasted like it had been sitting there a while. The dessert isn't even worth the calories or effort..it's just not good. Stick to the fruit and ice cream. 

Service is good and the wait for two on a Sunday night around 7pm was about 15 minute. The two stars taken off honestly comes from the messy restaurant. It's way too crowded, there are too many service stations and it seems like no one is picking up stray silverware and napkins from the floors. Kinda off putting in a restaurant. 

Will I come back? Probably not unless it's a big party..am I more likely to eat at a smaller sushi joint, definitely.

Great cost/benefit
Not the best sushi, but good enough for a buffet
Good variety of hot dishes and deserts
You can't beat the value. Cheaper then any Buffet on the Strip, and best then most

This is a good place for sushi and asian hot food buffet. I enjoyed their ramen bar mostly and their hand roll ordering station. They also had crab legs but I enjoy them better at buffets where they slice it open for  you so it's easier to eat. Decent price.

Let's just say, the pictures look better than the food looks, but as far as taste, it's not bad for what you pay and the amount you could possibly consume.

I definitely filled up on the sushi and rolls and although it wasn't pricey sushi bar, pristine quality, if you can look past the presentation, the taste ain't bad. It is what it is and you should know that going into it.

If you're not into fish, the other side of the buffet is properly satisfying. My husband isn't a fish guy, but he found the ribs, noodles, fried rice, Korean BBQ and chicken to be tasty and filling.

I wasn't a fan of the ramen, but I enjoyed watching the guy make my bowl. The fruit was very disappointing because last I checked, fruit should be sweet and juicy. This fruit was neither, though I watched one of the cooks diligently chopping it all up fresh. The chocolate fountain was fun as usual with the big marshmallows for dipping and the desserts were quintessentially Asian: a little different, light and not very sweet.

Bottom line: Going in with proper expectations you should be properly satisfied!

The food was all cold by the time we arrived  Friday night at 8:20pm. Shrimp tempura was cold, ribs, rice everything was cold. The sushi was terrible. The dessert was really good. I have been going to Makinos for 15 years now and I was extremely disappointed the last 2 times.

Note: prior to trying this place, I have never had sushi in my life. Yes, I'm 20 years old but I never took the consideration of trying sushi. Mainly because I don't enjoy Asian cuisine as much as I enjoy other food. 

But I came here with my family because it's a buffet and my fam loves sushi. Also note that I don't know nothing about what's what. Whatever looked good, I got. And I enjoyed it! I may be an amateur but whatever looks good is good. They also served other Asian dishes with various sorts of BBQ including Korean BBQ even though it wasn't that tasty. But the convenience of a buffet doesn't deserve too much negativity. For spending $15-20 for all you can eat, don't resist. Just eat. My review may not be that helpful. Mainly because I have very minimal knowledge of sushi and Asian cuisine. But for a guy who doesn't know much and hasn't tried much, to those who are in the same position as I was before trying sushi, give it a shot! Won't hurt.

High traffic of customers and dirty, when you walk in the place it smells of fish. Sushi is not suppose to smell fishy. If your on vacation in Vegas and craving a sushi sea food buffet this is not the place, do not eat here. The food is bland and the sushi is low quality. What seems popular with the locals and Asian community, seems to fall short if you are accustomed to good sushi (shout out to the SFV peeps) Please do not eat here save your money!!
Makino has a good variety of seafood and sushi.  I would prefer the crab legs be available as a warm dish, but I'm guessing they are served cold for health code reasons.
