Impressive buffet better than the overpriced Strip food.  Everyone seems to to want to get the shrimp tempura which clears fast.  Amazing how they stretch the shrimp so well.  Vast array of incredibly beautiful sushi...so good that they even disallow photos.

This is my to-go place for ayce sushi when I go to vegas. I love this place because the sushi chefs are constantly making new rolls. It seems like every time I go for seconds, there are new rolls that they make that I haven't tried yet. In that way it doesn't get boring. 

Great sushi but everything else is just ok. I tried the shrimp and veggie tempura, and fried dumplings. They were all just ok. I loved the green tea ice cream! Just $20 a person on a weekday afternoon.

LOTS of sushi options!! The fish was so fresh and delicious! There wasn't any prime rib though. The rest of the food options were okay. Dessert was bleh. I would definitely go there again for the sushi and maybe more crab legs.
Whenever I crave for sushi and asian fusion delicacies... I always come here as they have huge variety of food to choose from!!

great service went on a business dinner with 15 other people. food was great and with a variety of food so if your not a sushi fan there are plenty other options. My personal favorite thing for me was the strawberries with a chocolate fountain

I hesitate to tell you how good this place is because I don't want the world to over run it.

First, the 5 stars I'm giving are as much about value and service as the food. If you are looking for the $12 per piece sushi bar flavor or experience, you're not going to get that at Makino. You will get all you can eat, buffet style sushi, roles, tempura, seafood and deserts at a price that is more then fair.

The staff is always very pleasant and attentive. The beer is cold and the tea hot. Nothing sits around long enough to not be fresh. If you like sushi and you can't find $35.00 worth of something you like, you are either confusing sushi for McDonalds or you are the emperor of Japan and this is just beneath you.

My rule of thumb with ethnic food... If no one is speaking German, it's not much of a German restaurant. If there are no Chicano's there, you're at El Torito. Makino seems to have the ethnic cred.

Love this place.  It's easy, so many variety of foods from ramen, udon, so many different types of sushi, sukiyaki, fried shrimps, fried tempura, and you get to pick.  One by one.  You don't have to be stuck with plate full of one type of sushi, especially if  you don't like the sushi.   Been here bunch of times and will be going bunch more.
They just got C on the dirty dinning.The kitchen is dirty and the equipment is old and not fix.Cooler temperature is high.Ice maker is full of shit.

Went there for lunch and was very impressed. Large selection of sushi all of which seemec fresh. Rolls were unique and were constantly being made fresh. Tempura shrimp was also very good. Service was incredibly friendly and swift. I will be certain to return the next time I am in Las Vegas.

First of all, this is my fault, I don't like buffets and I decided to go there, at first it looked "ok" then when I was seated in one of the walls there were food stains, I was seduced by the idea of: "I love japanese food" obviously this is a buffet, I should know better, the rolls which to me are not japanese, were bland, the "nigiri" was tasteless basically everything was plain tasting, if you like buffets you can give it a try, this one was the nail in my buffet's coffin but what do I know...
I gave this one 2 stars because the mango ice cream was my favorite food in here.

Pictures look tasty, don't get fooled.

Something is SERIOUSLY wrong with this place.
Of all the sushi style rolls i've selected to come back to get eaten 4 of them were...unsanitary.
Two contained raw fish that was dried out as well as dried rice and smelt eggs are not suppose to be flat and darkly colored and dry wilted leaves for the rolls that support them, and avocado of brown to blackish color. 

This place gets one star for trying to poison it's customers and rob them of 20 dollars per person. 

Some things you can make in the morning and leave out until dinner and no one will be the wiser. YOU DO NOT DO IT WITH RAW FISH

EPIC FAIL

until i get a chance and 20 dollars to throw away for a redo

The sushi was pretty good,for it being a buffet. The sushi wasn't to die for but quality wasn't bad either. The rolls were plentiful, they did not label what was in each roll. So basically you had to grab and guess. I'd say my favorite part of Makino was the other choices, From the crab legs, to the mussels and shrimp. The miso and ramen selection as well as the CHOCOLATE FOUNTAIN!!!! Overall a good experience and will be back here again.
I want it to give it a 5 star cause the food is great the only problem was the restrooms. Dirty and broken.
Awesome place! There is a great variety of very tasty sushi....and the crab legs OMG!!!! One of my favorite seafood places!

This place is HORRIBLE! First of all, I got take out. I was charged more than what was stated. Secondly, the food was not as good. The rice was very stale and they rolls were covered in avocados to disguise the poor quality of the fish. There was not a single roll I enjoyed. Finally, the customer service was appalling. The hostesses took food out of to-go containers and threw them away right in front of us. They did not explain why they charged as much as they did. All of this combined with the very poor quality of the food made for an experience that makes me never want to come back.

This sushi AYCE was hands down, one of the BEST buffets I"ve ever been to!!! It was an explosion of flavors in my mouth. I think I was taken to FOOD HEAVEN and back!!! Yes I would have loved to camp outside and eat here everyday if that was possible! Wish I could box this restaurant and transport it home with me. YUM! My mouth is salivating just thinking about the food. They have a no picture policy but that did not stop me from clicking away on my iphone at the table. I wanted to remember this heavenly experience, and what better way than to capture it in pictures!!! I love the ready made sushi because I could taste away to my heart's content and return for more. I must have eaten 5 plates of food!!! Let's just say I ate sooooo much that I was stuffed for the rest of the day and didn't eat till later that evening. Until we meet again, I will be thinking of you in my DREAMS!!!
My friend recommended this . Hot food is pretty good, K food is tasty, Sushi is fresh, use your own judgment when it comes to sushi rolls. I would definitely come back

Coming in here was like a dream come true. I never knew that seafood buffets existed. I was so overwhelmed by so much goodness. I was stuffing my face until stomach fatigue - totally abusing my entire gastronomic system. Unlimited crab legs, tuna sashimi, salmon sashimi, nigiri, rolls, miso soup, desserts, everything I could ever want. 

But you know what they say about too much of a good thing. All of the aromas and visuals paralyzed me into submission. After a few bites, I felt immobile. I feel that if I had ordered the rolls a la carte, they would have been consumed without any issues. The mere fact that there was an abundance traumatized my entire sense of fact vs. fiction. Hunger and desire was no longer an issue. With so much goodness available, it was as if a curse was broken. I was freed from ever wanting more. And that is a beautiful thing.

I had a field day here. Ayce sushi and there was plenty to choose from. The sushi was pretty delicious I might say. Then onto the buffet selection. There was some very delicious varieties to choose from and I actually helped myself to the grilled shrimp in a split shell a couple of times... so delicious! The only thing that I didn't like was that we were placed in the back of the restaurant behind a large group of people who took up 3 large tables. It became very annoying to maneuver around these tables. Considering they had plenty of open tables up in the front of the main dining room area.

Japanese Seafood & Sushi Buffets are the best.  Especially in Las Vegas.  This is a must visit.  I ate so much Shrimp Tempura and Steamed Crab legs I went into a food coma.  Yes Food coma.  I could Breathe.  LOL.  Anyway. My husband had the Chix Kabob and Pork Spareribs and he was make sounds I've never heard coming out from him ever.  And he's a picky eater.  No Asian for him.  We had to go to Rio's buffet to finally come back to this restaurant.  Why pay $39.95 for a buffet when you can pay $29.99 for Sunday Dinner Buffet.  We will come back.  I loved the sushi and the hand rolls are to die for.We'll be back!

Food was good, got there before the rush of people came in.  Service was on appoint, constantly checking in on us.  Never seen a miso dispenser like that, makes me wish I had one of those at home.  I'd definitely come back here again.

Im really disappointed. It was referred to us by my friend. I am a sushi and sashimi lover. We went for dinner at around 6 pm. And come to find out that they run out of Salmon. NO MORE SALMON AT 6 PM????? You call you restaurant japanese seafood buffet???? They are serving dinner til 9:30.  We paid $30 each. 
I am not really happy with the experience. 
I will not recommend this place. Dont go to this place.
I'm giving 2 stars because our server is really nice and attentive.

If i were you, look for another seafood buffet. Its not worth it to pay $30.

Something was not quite right today. I've been here before and enjoyed the experience. This time the experience was sadly average. The salmon sashimi lacked freshness and flavor. The yellowtail tasted old. What hasn't changed though is their delicious tempura: tasty and crispy.

excellent buffet!!!!
sushi lovers heaven. big variety.
to date, the top recommendation for lunch or dinner (7 stars)

For a buffet, this place has the freshest sushi in all of Las Vegas. They offer a very nice variety of sushi, a salad bar, plenty of cooked Japanese style dishes, and delectable desserts that you can enjoy as well. I recommend going there for lunch on the weekdays  because you can get the most bang for your buck (M-Th 11:30am-2:00pm =  $15.95, Fri-Sun 11:30am-3:00pm + holiday = $16.95 ). However if you decide to go there for dinner there will be even more goodies at the buffet such as crab legs, oysters, shrimp cocktail and sashimi (M-Th = $24.95, Fri-Sun + holiday = $26.95). 

Service was friendly and excellent. They came by fairly frequently and cleared off our table as we got up for seconds and thirds. Will definitely come back again to gorge myself silly on sushi.

1/08/2017 - We loved it so much we came back for round 2. Food and service are still excellent. The all you can eat sushi is worth the price of admission and the hot entrees definitely gives this place extra value for a sushi buffet. Highly recommend.
One of my favorite lunch restaurants when visiting Vegas. Excellent sushi & maki rolls. Excellent service. Fair pricing.

loved how fresh the crab legs.  i dont eat raw fish so couldn't comment on sashimi or sushi.  but i am very happy with all other dishes.
Kalbi were grilled perfectly.
loved the udon and ramen.
loved the shave ice and dessert.
will definitely come back.

The sushi choices are good, I really wouldn't consider this the best place to go in Vegas. It's about $25 per person at lunch and is always packed so try and go early for dinner or lunch. The hot food choices are typical Chinese food. The offer soups, several seafood salads and grilled fish. The dessert area is actually the best thing to eat to me. I'm not to sure about a sushi roll with tuna fish? Is that just being too lazy? My husband likes it here because it's all you can eat. For me I would go eat else where so every time he mentions eating here, I cringe.

This place is bomb.

Instant sushi satisfaction guaranteed. Unlike other all you can eat sushi spots like Guyemon or Sushi Mon, there is no wait for sushi to be brought to your table. All of the sushi is set out ready for self service. The variety is decent with a ton of special rolls and nigiri. There's also hot food items available such as teriyaki chicken, baked fish, clams, mussels, calamari, udon, ramen, and miso soup.

The dessert selection is also more impressive than other AYCE sushi joints, with a good variety of ice cream, cakes, and fruit.

The pricing is a little better than other places too and there isn't much of a wait most of the time.

First off. It's an all you can eat seafood buffet. I should have known better going in. 

We came in around 8 on a Saturday night and they didn't once refresh the sushi, or any of the plates, that I could tell.  It's not cheap, and by the time we left I felt cheated. 

If I get sick, I'll place another review. Steer clear, Yelpers.

Wished there was more food selections and names on the sushi. I wanted to eat so much but im not sure what i am eating. Lol. The food was good. The sushi was fresh. The service was great. The staff were very friendly. We will definitely be back again when we are in town. My friend and I loved their tuna sashimi.

I love their wide variety of sushi. A lot of unique tasty sushi choices and their desserts were good as well. Their soup was good as well. I've been here 3 times already and I would go back. For the price of that buffet, you can't go wrong since there's a decent amount of seafood options.

I loved everything about it!

The sushi was GREAT!!!! The spicy rolls were so spicayy~ just the way i like it baby ;) AND they have a chocolate fountain!!! 

First, i started off with some nigiri and tofu salad. Then, i got all the rolls that came out. and then i ate some miso soup. Theyre miso is interesting and fresh because they put cabbage in it as well as the seaweed and tofu. 

BUT, their mango pudding and ice cream was really nasty.... but who cares! they have a chocolate fountain!!!! :)

This is not your creme dela creme of Sushi goodness, however the sushi assortment is great presentation wise as it is lovable on your tastebuds.  Right from the get go, the lovely staff will greet you with mushi mushi hehe...friendly and on point with refills on beverage.  The price is very reasonable...it is all you can eat buffet...so there is no limit on how much you get.  Its not your average local hometown buffet or buffet@asia price...but you get your moneys worth and then some.  Asides from sushi, they also have an assortment of seafood, asian foods and tempura shrimps and veggies...not to forget a great variety in the Dessert Bar, which includes a chocolate fondue and crepe station to name a few scrumptious treats.  Come Hungry! Another not so secret tip is....try not to eat the rice with the sushi so you dont get filled up so fast...you will be able to taste an array of selections...and definitely get your sushi worth and then some! :)

Everything is good and fresh the selection of Sushi rolls, Nigri & Sashimi provides a great amount of variety. They can make hand rolls and Soyu and Tonkatsu Ramen upon request at one of their order stations. It's a great place to exposed someone who is not familiar with Sushi or Japanese food. With over a hundred food choices, I particularly enjoyed the crab legs and seafood entrée, Japanese fried rice and teriyaki selections.

My family and I go their all the time  for special occasion so last night we went their to celebr6 my  boy friends birthday  but I was really disappointed my oldest daughter and I wanted some ice cream for dessert but no one came out to help me or their was no one their to help us.  We stood their waiting for a good 3-5 minutes and no one came out.  plus she wanted this sugar cookie and it was not filled we waited for 30 minutes and still was not filled so we left disappointed at this place.

This place has the freshest sushi selection in town!  I love all of their offerings especially their green tea ice cream.  Give this place a try when in Vegas.  Not too far from the strip and excellent pricing make this place amazing.

Love comming here.., its part of our Memorial Day Tradition.
Just SUPER BUMMED they closed the Premiun Outlet Mall location!!

This place is pricier than any other AYCE.  The quality is very low and you can see people sneezing around the food.  Selection is very low and if you like specialty sushi, then this place is not for you.

This is my go-to sushi place and is the best I've found in all of Las Vegas.  To say their sushi is creative is an understatement.  It's like fireworks going off in your mouth.  

As much as I love them, I have to say they truly outdid themselves tonight.  The array of seafood was vast to say the least.  The colors of sushi prepared before me looked like art... red roe, green, pink then yellow creams, white and brown sauces, pink, green and black wraps, scallions, peppers, and so may other vegetables and flavorful crunchies adorned each round roll with such exquisite care it looked as if they had taken extra time to get everything just right.  I told one chef it was absolutely beautiful.  He smiled and went back to his work.  It's so nice to eat at a restaurant that takes such pride in its food.  

There are about 5 sushi chefs behind the counter at all times.  I really couldn't tell you what else is on the buffet.  I haven't looked and I don't really care.  It's all about the sushi.  By the way, did you know they do takeout sushi?  30-50 cents per roll.  I hit them on my way home from work and get 2 boxes full for the price of one buffet.  It's a great alternative to cooking after a long day at work and you WON'T ever see this quality of sushi to-go elsewhere.  Believe me, I tried.

My husband, me and his dad were all munching on sushi tonight from Makino while kicking back and watching TV.  I should mention that before trying Makino my husband told me he hated sushi.  Now the only sushi he will eat is from Makino.  His dad told me the same thing tonight.  That was before he tried it.  After the first bite, he was hooked.  If you don't feel up to going out, or would feel lame eating a buffet all by yourself, or like me, know it would be impossible to eat $25 worth of sushi at a buffet.  Dear Lord that's a lot of sushi!  Take out is definitely the way to go.       

Either way, if you stay or go, you'll still be pleased.  I've never had a bland sushi roll at Makino.  They've never been sub-par or fishy.  I know I'm not the only fan as I sat for lunch at work today and a coworker ordered sushi from somewhere else.  He was lamenting the fact that we didn't work closer to Makino.  He had to settle for sushi that had no special sauces, no crispy toppings, no sparkly roe and NO personality... just crab, shimp and scallions inside plain white rice.  Boring.  Unimaginative.  Those are 2 words I can never say about Makino.  

So what are my favorite rolls?  
Crab, cream cheese and cucumber deep fried in batter.  It's absolutely addictive and when I get take-out it usually doesn't make it home.  I've already eaten it on the way.  Eel with teriyaki sauce, scallions, and a crispy topping is a favorite.  I have to be honest... I can identify the octopus, yellowfin, etc... but sometimes I really have no clue what all they are using in those beautiful little rolls.  I've never tried one I didn't like, though.  That's reassuring when you don't always know what you're grabbing.  

I've been eating at Makino regularly for about 4 years now.  I can confidently say that if you don't stop in, you're really missing out.

The sushi is decent buffet style sushi, but they had a bunch of weird flavors. There was a spicy guacamole tasting one, a bunch of rolls with BBQ sauce on them, a tuna salad one, and many others that were not appetizing to me. I like the classic rolls, and I was glad that they also had some of those. 

I really liked their dessert section. I liked the chocolate fondue and selection of fresh fruits. I also liked their coconut pudding cups and different types of small pastries.

I didn't care for their hot food section. I ate some baked fish, which was just mediocre. I think they should include more cooked vegetables in this section.

I wish that instead of udon, they could make ramen soup. I know ramen is more expensive, but we are paying almost $30 for dinner.

This place has really gone Hill since I last ate here about 4-5 years ago, while the price went up from $15.95 to $28.95.

It isn't horrible but for this price I expect it to be better than those casino buffets. Because if it isn't, then I rather go to one of those other buffets where the selection is better.

Safe to say... I won't be back.

Great price for the quality.  

I was surprised to see this place only averages about 3.5 stars.  The majority of "bad reviews" complain about non trivial aspects of the restaurant that don't apply to the average person. 

Food quality is always consistent, good variety, and fresh. 

The ratio of fish/rice is better than most full cost restaurants I've been to (they don't overpack the rice or do the old "double rice roll" to save on cost. 

Refills and plate clearing are quick.  Can't ask for much more when it comes to a sushi buffet. 

Hot food, salad, rolls, nigiri, and dessert. 

I snapped three quick pics of the food for general reference. 

I always visit this place when I'm in Vegas.

I am from out of state and this place came highly recommended for dinner from a friend who lives here. I can truly say that this place was a good call for sushi and seafood that would not break your budget. This restaurant has now become one of my go to places whenever I return back to Las Vegas. I will definitely be back.
Good variety of fresh sushi and rolls. And lots of other Japanese food.  Highly recommend.  We also go to the one in Irvine.

I would rather go here any day than pay double or even triple at a buffet on The Strip. Is it the best sushi in the world? No, but it's $20 AYCE sushi plus an assortment of other Chinese/Japanese/Korean/American dishes. Plus you can also make your own ramen, stir-fry and ask for freshly made sushi hand rolls. Their green tea and mango ice cream is really good too! This buffet hits all the right spots at a great price point.
The very best sushi buffet ever! Awesome selection of sushi, nigiri, sashimi and all the traditional non-sushi dishes. Worth going off the strip for.
I'm here every month. I come here for lunch at 11:30 am as soon as it opens.. LoL! I go for the all you can eat sushi... for the price it's worth it!!!!!

Whenever we drop by Sin City.
We always eat here.
Best price in town for buffet.
Decent seafood.
They had two locations.
We actually started to going the one at the outlets, but that closed down because their 10 year lease was up.
So thats when we started going to this location on Decatur. 
Same food.
Same friendly staff.
Truth be told there are a lot of choices in Vegas when it comes to buffet. 
However almost all of them are in the range of $$$.
Honestly I don't need to be spending $40 - $60 a person for a buffet.
It's just not justified to pay that much.
For first tourists wanting to be "wowed" they'll pay that ridiculous prices.
As for myself. Who goes here about 10 times a year, I'm practically a local, no way!
Anyhow here's the low down on Makino LV:

Location is superb. (Especially if you're staying in The Orleans, Gold Coast, Rio, & Palms Casino, literally a 2min drive with no traffic!) 
Regular Lunch $17
Holiday Lunch $20 (Includes all major Holidays)
Regular Dinner $20
Holiday Dinner $24 (Inlcudes all major Holidays)

Their sushi & sashimi are excellent.
Of course its not a trafitional Japanese sushi joint per se, but for the price, you get a decent amount of sushi & sashimi heaven.
I personally always get their Tuna, & Salmon sashimi, as well from their wide selection of rolls.

Cold section they have (not a complete list)
-Various selection of cold sashimi concoctions example: Regular salad, Sashimi salad etc

Hot section they almost always have the following:
-FRIED RICE (with eggs) not bad. not too oily. very sou saucy.
-FRIED NOODLES (it's not Chow Mein) Before it used to be bery salty. But as of our last few visits, it's been improved. Not too salty and prettt darn good.
-KOREAN BBQ I'm not a fan of it. I know my KBBQ, it doesn't taste quite like it. Plus the beef I find to be dry at times because of the heat lamps. Again not a fan.
-FRIED CALAMARI Again not a fan. It's ok. Comes with its own sauce. 
-BAKED SALMON It's actually pretty darn good. It's just that it's overshadowed by the Salmon sashimi, otherwise I'd be all over this.
-BAKED MUSSELS This is one of my favorite. Really good & tasty.
-SHRIMP & VEGETABLE TEMPURA It's really nice that they have the shrimp & the vegetable tempuras separated. Because we all know everyone always goes for the shrimp because it's delicious with the tempura sauce especially. Just be careful because the batter on the tempura coating will fill you up rather quickly!
-BEEF SUKIYAKI Oh my oh my.......My absolute favorite here! It's heaven on a bowl. Honestly, it's good! Beef is absolutely tender. Same for the tofu. Melt in your mouth goodness! The sauce also is really good. It's a meal by itself. Highly recommened it!

SOUP SECTION:
MISO SOUP (never tried this) but they have them premade with the chunks already in bowls. 
All you have to do is choose a bowl you want & then place it on their MISO Soup machine that spits out the soup unto your bowl, with the chunks already in it.

RAMEN SECTION:
The reason why I never tried their Miso Soup.
You have a choice of either Shoyu or Tonkotsu Soup base. Hot, Mild, or Non-Spicy.
You can choose to have more or less of everything off the ramen contents.
I personally always get Tonkotsu, Non Spicy, extra noodles, extra fried onions.....oh and the sauce is fantastic, esecially if you had been drinking the previous night and wanted to re- hydrate your system. It's oh so nourishing!

DESSERT SECTION:
They have multitudes of different cakes & cookies.
Fruits also. They also have a Chocolate Fondue Fountain.
Honestly what kicks ass is their ICE CREAM!
They a various flavors but the only thing that really matters to me is their GREEN TEA, CHOCOLATE, and oh boy it's a perfect ending!

The staff here are all Japanese women (mostly)
Their all cute, very slim especially with their all black uniforms they wear. Their also full of energy & perk.
Make sure to leave a good tip, they work very hard. Always a great time here.

So in conclusion, if you find yourself in Sin City, & wanted to have a decent buffet for a decent price. 
Go no further than Makino on decatur.

Ok, there are probably much better sushi buffets or AYCE joints around town but for the price you really can't beat Makino. Now that the Premium Outlets location closed, I decided to come to this one. It's been a while since I last visited this location and was probably way back when they first opened it. 

We walked in at around 12:30 PM and were immeidately seated. We noticed that the restaurant was super cramped and crowded compared to the old outlet location, mainly because the space is smaller and it looked like they crammed as many tables as they could into the small space. Our table was about 2 inches away from the table next to us and located right by the dessert area of the buffet, which meant there were constantly people squeezing by. Space aside, our meal was excellent and we left in a dazzed food coma.

The buffet area includes a salad bar, sushi area with various sushi rolls, nigiri and hand rolls, a hot food area serving various appetizers (gyoza, wings, etc) and Japanese food including udon and ramen stations. Lastly there is a dessert area with various sweets, ice cream and a chocolate fountain. We were way too full at the end of our meal to really have dessert, but I can never pass up green tea ice cream and the one here is no exception. I ended up stuffing a scoop down before leaving.

Overall for $17.95 + drinks ($16.95 on weekdays for lunch), you can't beat it anywhere in the valley. Just know that if you come earlier, it could be way more crowded and a line can form. By about 1 PM the crowds died down and we didn't feel as cramped moving around the buffet.

Such a waste of money! I was very disappointed when I came here for my friend's birthday dinner. I paid $27.00 for food that was not good. I usually enjoy Asian buffets, but I was not thrilled with this one. I will not be back.

First ones in the door! We saw a whole lot of food and I'm going to try to remember what they had....
Starting on the left were the desserts: cheesecake slices, pies, puddin, jello, 5 different kinds of ice creams such as red bean, green tea, cookies and cream and two others I'm spacing. Next were the soups; a miso soup machine with toppings, the ramen bar, two additional soups on the day (pork soy something and beef when I went), next were ceviches and salads, then came the sushi. No sashimi but that didn't stop me from just grabbing sushi and removing the rice (tacky yes, but tasty) there was octopus, salmon, tuna, masago and 6 different types of rolls. Altogether we would go back.

I remembered when this place first opened. It was the hot spot for a lot of people then all these AYCE SUSHI places started to pop up everywhere. Needless to say, for the price you pay you might as well go to those AYCE sushi places. Makinos sushi is mediocre compared to other places. It is buffet style so what can you expect right? It is kind of nice that they do serve hot foods too and a fresh soup area where you can have them make the soup the way you want it. Service was quick and it almost feels like they want you to hurry up and eat and leave.

A chain of japanese sushi buffet. Why only 3 stars when I am so easy to please? PLUS sushi is my ultimate favorite?

The sushi here is not very fresh. The fish all seemed a little luke warm. The selection was very mediocre. I love sushi sushi, not rolls.. They had way too many rolls drenched in cream sauce. gross. 

Also, they have this really annoying rule that you have to finish every single grain of rice on your plate or they will charge you on top of the 26 dollars they already charged for dinner. 

Some of the perks? chocolate fountain and green tea cakes for dessert! lots of tempura miso soups, endless crab.. well made seaweed salads and calamari dishes!

Dinner stops at 830pm. And they stop making food around 8pm. From then on, its all left over scraps. Also, they charge for $3 for hot tea and the servers are pretty rude. Ive been to many other sushi buffets, and this doesn't even come close. I would rather try the other buffets in Vegas.

After browsing through yelp, I came across Makino bc I was craving some good sushi but wanted to try a new resto. My wife and I came here at around noon. Lunch was around $19 on a Wednesday. FYI: from Fri-Sun, they increase the price $1 more. The place was about 1/2 full already having opened an hour before. The spread was great: different types of sushi, fried rice, salads, korean chicken, ramen, desserts, etc.. The buffet was not as huge like the ones on the Strip but it was good enough variety. I particularly liked the seaweed and salad dishes bc they cleanse your palate after eating those fried and heavy foods. The only negative I could say about this place is that the sushi are not labeled so you don't really know what kinds of sushi you are eating. Ironically, all the other food/dishes in the resto are labeled. But overall, I think this is a good place to eat for a special occasion with a group. Good asian food at a good price...

The best local seafood buffet hang out!! The food is always fresh, the pay attention to details, refill all platters right away, it's simply our best family restaurant hang out! The price is reasonable for what they serve. This is where all the locals go, and their guests!

Overrated.
Description says there are vegan options, but they are limited. And several of the sous chef's didn't know what vegan was when I asked if certain dishes were vegan. 
I did have a vegan roll prepared and it was ok. Overall, I'm not impressed with the caliber of the food or this buffet. But my husband and our niece & nephews enjoyed their seafood.
I have been coming here for years. Great food but the place gets a little crowded and tables are too close to each other. Avoid peak hours.

The line was ridiculous and food was very bland. Sushi looks like it's been there for awhile because the rice was very hard. Pricier than Omani. The only plus was our server. She's very nice and friendly.

I thought this was a GREAt buffet for the price.
The sashimi was fresh (not fishy at all), the service was great (when I asked for horseradish, they made a big deal about finding me some in the back kitchen)
All you can eat oysters was really the reason I came here, and they were just so/so...the crab legs were cold, which I hate, but the sushi was great, and the shrimp tempura was great.
I have no complaints other than they didn't keep the buffet stocked well, and they started breaking down about an hour and a half before they were supposed to close.

The best sea food buffet ever! They have a ton of sushi! They have myriad of Asian dishes to choose from! Anything you May want they have in their buffet! They have teriyaki, soups, salads, desserts and many more. Best authentic Asian food in all of LV! Their customer service is always amazing!

I love this place! They have a lot of seafood selections and their sushi is pretty decent. I don't just go for their sushi but their other stuff like their ramen station and fried calamari, octopus and of course their shrimp tempura. Their dessert station sucks though, but the green tea ice cream is worth trying.

Whoa - I don't know what to say other than the sushi here was mediocre.  I was very, very disappointed in light of other people's reviews.  But, then again, if this is among the best that Las Vegas has to offer - then it's best not to eat sushi and instead go to a seafood buffet elsewhere.  

Maybe it's the recession but the cost was comparable to other buffets just on the Strip but the quality was much worse so the drive and the cost is soooooo not worth it.

Great selection and good service. I love the selection of sushi and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The price was reasonable especially considering the quality of the food. I will be coming back here often.

Awesome AYCE sushi. They have egg custard which is my favorite. The only down side is its a little brown. But, still delicious. The sushi offered includes nigari and combo rolls. The buffet has both a hot and cold side offering salads and Chinese food. Dessert includes Thrifty ice cream. So good. The servers are very sweet and I have never had to wait for a refill.

My go to sushi place every time I'm in NV. So many sushi choices and crab legs galore.    I felt like I needed to be rolled out of there due to my food coma. There are several dessert options. The creme brûlée was the best!

This place has very good and fresh sushi. I was seated quickly and was getting my first plate in minutes of arriving. I will definitely tell my friends about this place. It was very busy, but all the different types of nigiri and rolls were available. Place was clean and the staff was polite. Only reason I gave 4 stars is that I have never been to a place which deserved 5 stars.

We dined at this AYCE restaurant on 4/11/17 when we were in Las Vegas visiting.  Since Todai closed over a year ago, we have been trying to find another Japanese Sushi and Seafood AYCE buffet in Vegas.  The restaurant is located about 10-15 minute drive from Elara in a strip mall.  Yes, like other reviews, the setting is not the newest and expect somewhat crowded tables sitting just a few feet from the patrons eating at the next table.  However, the food at this place exceeded my expectations and is much better than at the Todai that closed in Miracle Mile mall.  The selection of sushi, nigiri, sashimi, and hand rolls were vast and tasted fresh and delicious.  The other hot food offerings were OK and adequate though the quality of the Ramen and Udon were close to that of Ramen noodle restaurant and much better than one expected from AYCE.  The dessert choices were fine with the red bean ice cream surprisingly outstanding.  Best value is definitely going during lunch.  The weekend price is only a dollar more than week day prices.  Overall a great ACYE restaurant with high quality sushi and nigiri.  Definitely highlight of our visit this time to Las Vegas finding this gem.  Apparently according to the waitress, the owner Makino started Todai and sold the restaurants to some corporations years ago.  I guess that makes this one the original restaurant of the subsequent Japanese Seafood AYCE restaurants.  Plan to revisit when we return to Las Vegas next time.

In a city like Vegas where buffets are abundant and at almost every corner, it's hard to stick out. Asian buffets all tend to be the same as well- typical orange chicken and mediocre egg rolls can usually be seen. I'll be the first to admit I did not expect much when I got invited to Makino LV for a birthday party. I thought to myself how this would just be another Asian buffet. It was thus with a pleasant surprise to find Makino LV did stick out and was different good way!

There was no orange chicken or mediocre egg rolls but instead an array of various sushi of all kinds. There was shrimp tempura, vegetable tempura, crispy teriyaki chicken, beef short ribs, chicken and vegetable skewers. They also had ramen made to order. Choice of ramen were tonkotsu and Shoyu. Diners could also make their own udon soup. 

From the savory items, I found the beef short ribs to be of good flavor and the crispy teriyaki chicken was tasty! I found the ramen to be a very nice. I got the tonkotsu ramen and the broth was rich and robust in flavor. 

For dessert, sweet lovers could feast on sweet treats like white chocolate raspberry, creme brûlée and Oreo cheesecake! There were fresh ice cream scoops that seemed to be a crowd favorite. Ice cream flavors included red bean, green tea and cookies and cream. My sweet tooth was pleased with my own dessert creation of cookies and cream ice cream topped with a white chocolate raspberry and a cookie brittle. 

Makino LV surprised me in a good way. It was different from other Asian buffets and it made a mark for this foodie. It's always nice to have good surprises :). In a city of buffets, it's nice to see Makino LV be a little different.

Never!!!! Ever!!! Again!!!! Whoever stated this place has the freshest sushi in town, y'all lyin!! That or you've never had fresh sushi. It's not even a subjective or bias thing, it's literally not fresh. Let me start with the negatives and then I'll let you know why I'm even granting at least 2 stars.

The sushi taste as bad as they look. The salmon nigiri was stiff, as if it was still frozen but not cold. The tuna nigiri was so pungently fishy, I couldn't even swallow. Between the two that I've tried, I couldn't get myself to try the rest I had on my plate. We were here for my Dad's birthday, and for the price we paid, I am so regretful. We could have gone to a nice AYCE sushi spot for the same price.

Two stars granted only for their endless shrimp tempura and Dungeness crab legs. That's it! Not enough to ever bring me or my family back here!!!!

This place went above and beyond yesterday I appreciate them taking  us  last min for a 10 top we originally had reservation at a different spot but they doubble booked Makino was Happy to take are business and had a table put together by the time we got there food was delicious like always and are server was on top of it and my 9yr told the server it was my bday so she made plans with him to bring me a cake thank you for  making my birthday an enjoyable experience!

If you're a sushi lover, this is a definitely must try. AYCE sushi.

Price is very reasonable , food is off the chain, and location is convenient for all.

All the sushi you can think of - salmon roll to poke and sashimi.

Weekend price per adult $29.99 - children depends on height and age (call them).

Other menu items include Udon bowls made to order, ceviche, cold asian seafood salad and of course tempura.

Is this one the same owner of the one in Rowland height CA ?  If it is then this one is too bad compare to the one in Rowland heights!  The food here is not fresh. And doesn't have many choice!  the one in Rowland height is very delicious and have lots of choice. This one doesn't have any oyster too!  And I think they put a lot of msg in their food cause when I back to home, I feel very thirsty!  Same name. Different quality!  Don't come here Las Vegas one again. Go to the one in Rowland heights which is very good sushi buffet!

My husband wanted us to try this place out. He loves buffets and was excited to find one that is a sushi one. I'm not a big fan of buffets and was hesitant to go. Glad I agreed to come. Great variety of sushi, they have the raw stuff and the fried stuff. They also have soups, salads and other great varieties. Super clean the price was $21.95/ adult. But it's very well worth it given the options and amount of sushi and hand rolls you can throw down. I will definitely come back when I'm in Vegas again. Didn't give 5 stars because the staff is constantly going around re-filling your drink.
Very good food and lots of variety. Sushi/Sashimi is very fresh. The only reason I am giving it 4/5 stars is that the seating was pretty disorganized and crowded & was pretty expensive.

I love Makino's normally...but this last visit to this particular one kind of got to me. We came in for my nieces birthday and she loves sushi and crab legs. Anyway..the food was great..but the service not too good. I totally understand the gratuity part but really $40 gratuity for someone to refill my soda and water cups. Seriously...we had to remind her that we needed some drinks. Oh and we had to ask them to take our plates away. So overall if you want sushi this is a great place...but if you want top notch service...stay away from this one...

Well where do I start ?....overstuffed and defeated that's for sure! Listen folks for the price you pay. You're getting a great deal big time. The waitress are always on point. They're so friendly, nice and helpful. 
   I've been there for both dinner and lunch. Not in the same day of course. Big difference between the meals. Is that dinner you have a "build your own" handroll set up. And cooked food selection is fancier. Either way it's a win win for sure. Plus the iced green is good too. 
  For an AYCE spot the food is always on point. The quality is good consistently. Plus you see it being made fresh. And the udon noodle selection is awesome too. I always add shrimp tempura. Trust me folks this place has everything for everyone.

A great buffet, perhaps the best in town. There's a huge variety of sushi and plenty of non-sea food items to enjoy.

The deserts are surprisingly tasty,

If you're a sushi fan this AYCE is on point. There's a pretty nice spread of sushi here. Lots of raw and cooked options. The rest of the food is decent also, crab legs, clams, fish, chicken teriyaki , mussels, tempura shrimp, fried oysters and vegetables . My favorite would have to be the soup noodles, udon or ramen tonkotsu or shoyu broth. Cheaper than most the buffets on the strip but a 15 min taxi from the strip to get to Makino. 

Price : on a Monday was under $30 for dinner. Waitress tagged my mom on the senior tab , about $5 less . The quality fits the price. Satisfied 

Selection: lots of sushi, noodle soups, seafood , chicken, ribs, short ribs, dessert bar.

Service staff: was nice. Attentive , but to note we were there 20 min after dinner started. 

Wait time: On a Monday , dinner starts @5:30. We got there at 5:50. No wait , seated promptly . Clean. 6:30 madhouse started. Busy and lines to get food. Goes fast tho.

I came here for my birthday lunch whilst in Vegas on a Saturday. I reserved a table for 20 people and they gave me a whole section up near the right hand side of the restaurant.

The food was great as per usual. They were able to split bills per table. They did add the gratuity to our bill which i believe was 20%. 

The food is awesome. Great selection of sushi and fresh! And for those that don't eat sushi, there is Chinese food there as well! 

Dessert is also good. They also brought me out a little birthday cake which was really lovely! 

I love it here and i would recommend this place to anyone!

I remember coming here like 8-9 years ago when I first came here to eat. I was so surprised with all the different sushi and deserts you can get to eat. I was so happy and excited that it was so cheap and fresh the food. Ate 6 plates full of sushi with no space left hehee. I'm a fattie. Ate so much, had to unzip my shorts LoLz  . Went back to NY and told everyone lolz.
Everyone is very nice. Our server Jaclyn is especially nice and very patient. The hand rolls are very tasty.

There are so many buffets in Las Vegas but this is one we NEVER miss when there. They have all the crazy sushi with drizzled sauces, traditional sushi, as well as fresh sashimi. Along with all the sushi they have different types of Japanese salads and soups, hot dishes both seafood and non-seafood. The desserts are small bites and tasty.....if you leave some room. My personal favorite are these flat carmelized sugar almond "cookies". Shhhhhh....I may sneak one or two out in my purse for later.

While I was taking pictures, one of the workers told me to stop and that I wasn't allowed to. I didn't know I couldn't, so I didn't really appreciate that they didn't come up to me and tell me quietly rather than shout at me from behind the counter.

Besides this, Makino's is one of the best asian buffets I've ever been to.  While their sushi was subpar for me, they still had a pretty wide selection. I really loved their hot foods though because they offered items I've never had elsewhere. Battered items such as tonkatsu and tempura were very fresh, lightly battered, and well prepared. I really enjoyed their sukiyaki as well. The trays and counters were kept clean, and were constantly refilled. You can also order freshly made handrolls, udon, and ramen. The desserts also really impressed me both in flavor and presentation. Everything was good and you can definitely tell the quality is higher than the desserts you'd find at a Chinese buffet.

This buffet was disgusting. No one asked how we were doing, no one asked how our food was, if we needed refills, or any type of service. I wanted to talk to the manager so badly, but I worked in the food industry for years and hated when people did that. We barely ate one plate of food for $64. All you can eat sushi places are better than this. I didn't eat the crab legs or the other "pricey" items. The nigiri was sad and dry looking. I had a few pieces and traded in my plate for the cooked items. The only thing worth eating was the tempura shrimp and veggies. Trust me when I say go to any other all you can eat sushi for better quality and service(any of them, seriously). If you're visiting from out of town, stick to the bigger buffets that are in the hotels. The M buffet is about $15 more for all you can eat and drink. I'm having a hard time believing that people like this place. Not to offend anyone, but if you enjoyed this place recently, and you ate the sushi, you have no idea what good sushi is. Sushi does not have lettuce inside to make up space where fish should be. 
Please don't waste your money here! They're also charging $34 a person on Father's Day! The nerve to increase the price, but probably decrease the quality so they make more money.

My favorite local Japanese/Sushi go to!  Selection is awesome, constantly changing & fresh.
The buffet includes;
-Sushi
-Many hot Japanese dishes
-Numerous salads
-Soup Miso/Noodle
-Fresh fruit
-Deserts
-Ice cream, my favorite is the Red Bean
I have dinned here nearly 100 times, and brought dozens of guest!  Don't forget the iced green tea as a refreshing beverage.

very good place to go for sushi?especially when u r super hungry?food quality is good and fresh??
been here several time and will continue to go for sure?

Ehhh i thought this place was just ok. But the bf loves it here. He really likes the sushi here. Says that it isn't all rice. I think he mainly likes the sashimi and hand rolls that they make. They also have an udon area where u can push a machine and dispense your own soup. I saw a Ramen area too. They had grilled korean meats and other dishes too. But more than half the buffet was sushi options.
great BUFFET it s a place to come back... fresco Sea food ..soups are great ...I visit Las Vegas every year ...I will be back year after year

A great ayce sushi and buffet restaurant. They have a large variety or rolls and nigiri with not too much rice (compared to other ayce places). I especially like their hand rolls. They don't overdo the rice and put a decently generous amount of raw fish. They also have a great variety of hot foods and salads and desserts.  We've been here a few times and have enjoyed it every time. The service was quick and efficient even though it was ayce. Our water glasses were never empty and it seemed the second we finished our plate, the waitress had cleared it for us in preparation for a new plate.

My family loves going here.

It's a nice place for families and big groups. The wait staff is very polite and attentive. Their buffet selection is good and will please pretty much anybody. Yay for Makino!

Went here for lunch and the pictures and reviews I saw do not match what this place is like. Extremely crowded with very strange people who eat their items as they go through the line. Sushi tastes mostly the same and is a lot lower quality than what I would expect in Vegas. The inside seems old and unclean. I have had better sushi and sashimi in little hole in the wall sushi places in the Midwest. Price is not worth it at all. The other items such as udon bowls are sub-par compared to other locations in This part of Vegas.

Food was decent but they seem to follow the industry standard of ignoring your table after 30 min. We had two adults and three young children which means it takes 20 min. Just to get everyone's food. We got one refill and the server let our plates pile up. Definitely gave me the impression of being rushed. When date nights are rare as it is, I'll not be wasting any more time or my money here.
Best bang for your buck here. All you can eat seafood, even oysters and crabs!

I was really excited about this place but it wasn't what I expected. Especially at the price. They had a pretty good selection, unfortunately the people in our group who didn't like sushi as much weren't very impressed with the other options(maybe that's our fault). It was really crowded but from what I saw, plates stayed full. Won't be back again but at least I went...

700th review.
And it's all about my buffet-obsessed husband.
"for better for worse, for richer for poorer, in sickness and in health, to love and to cherish, till death us do part"   
He claims that there's a Buffet Clause somewhere in there.  
I am his Reluctant Buffet Queen.

Makino has been his WallyWorld for years, thanks to his work buddies.
We made it a point to get over there on this trip to Vegas.

Showed up 20 minutes early and since it was real chilly outside, decided to wait in the car.
But then he noticed that there were already people lined up at the door.
And then, people were walking past our car to get in line.
"Get out of the car!  Get out of the car!  Hurry!"  
Okay.
By the time the door opened, there was quite a crowd behind us.  He got all excited.  "Must be good, yeah!"

Gotta say, these diners don't mess around.
It was like the quick or the dead.
I was doing my usual walk by all the counters to see what was offered.
I normally shy away from buffet sushi, but the nigiri looked really good.  So I doubled back.  In less than a minute and there was only 1 piece of salmon nigiri left on the tray!  Daaaang!
Was able to get some tako, ika, ahi, scallop, saba & 1 salmon handroll too.  Only one polite piece of each because there were so many other things I wanted to try.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/makino-lv-las-vegas?select=VyMA0WwBNEZGOMJNFpdwxg
The hubby's an organized buffet strategist.  By the time I got back to the table with my one plate of sushi and bowl of udon, he had several plates filled with items from different counters.   He looked so adorably happy.

A few mentions:
Nigiri-  The sashimi was good quality.  So good that I didn't bother with the wasabi & shoyu.  Just savored the freshness as is.  The tako (octopus) was especially good; sliced thin & just a bit chewy.
 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/makino-lv-las-vegas?select=wH8jGzPHkcumsawKM8MNWA
The Udon bar-  LOVED this!  There's veggie & shrimp tempura right next and I made a tempura bowl.  There's eggplant, asparagus & sweet potato in with the veggies.  Fresh grated ginger to add in.  The hubby saw how much I was enjoying it and made himself 2 bowls.
Yakisoba & calamari salad-  Hubby's 2 favorites of the day.  Went back for more.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/makino-lv-las-vegas?select=ZHwl9sFfUcB8DOfl51yijg
Seafood ceviche-  Beautiful & tasty!  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/makino-lv-las-vegas?select=V2SXkPvdLTE0SILfY6DibQ
Dessert bar-  Couldn't resist and got a coffee jello & matcha cake.  Was about to walk away, but that lady asked if I wanted some ice cream.  Might as well, I already knew my glucose reading was going to be high from the starches & fried food.  "Sure!  Green tea, please!"   (2 hours later- 215)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/makino-lv-las-vegas?select=lwXIaQIL9F0bRAPDAVpoZw

Service-  They're on top of their game here.
The servers were adeptly going in and out amongst the tables, clearing the dishes & refilling the drinks.
The guys in the sushi station were quickly replenishing the trays.

The hubby's expectations were more than fulfilled.  
He was amazed that I ate more than usual.  Well, yeah!  The food offerings were so good that I wanted to eat instead of doing my usual nibbling.
This buffet kicked our butts.  Instead of going to our planned afternoon destination, we went back to our hotel for food coma naps.

Yes.  Return visits & will recommend Makino to friends & family.


Note:  This place is so popular that it was at capacity within 10 minutes!
When we left, there was a crowd out there shivering in the cold, waiting to get in.
Like I said earlier, quick or the dead.

I always come here when in Vegas.  You can't beat the price and selection for a seafood heavy buffet in this town.  I love the shrimp tempura and assortment of makis.  This place can get very crowded, which is a good sign that everything will be fresh.  Thankfully Makino is located next to a Food 4 Less if you have to get some Tums due to over consumption.

I loved the one downtown so when they closed I searched for this place.  So happy the quality was good. Pace yourself as the selections are plentiful. The ramen chef took intense pride in his work. Sushi was fresh and not dried out. Chocolate fountain was s nice treat.

Came here for lunch.  They had a sign saying they raised the prices as of June 1, 2014.  Lunch was $17.95, no drink included.  I've been to several sushi buffets and this one was definitely below par for the price charged.  They kept running out of sushi and hot food and it would take them awhile to fill up the containers.  The sushi was nothing to rave about.  All of the rolls just kind of blended together in taste; nothing note worthy.  No sashimi (without rice).  For that price, I expected more.  The hot food was rather greasy and just the run of the mill Asian buffet.

It opens at 11:30pm for lunch.  There is usually a line that forms about 11:15am but it moves quickly once they open for lunch.  It's $20.95 for the all you can eat sushi and seafood buffet, and there is no menu here.  You must eat the buffet.  I have been to Todai buffets in south Korea, Hawaii, Oregon, Seattle and Virginia, and I would rank Makino one level above Todai.  The selection is more extensive and the quality of the seafood is slightly better.  This Makino is similar in quality and experience to the Makino in Pearl City, Hawaii.  Be sure to come hungry.

Been here many times before. The food is still good. I love the fresh sashimi and sushi every time...love the yummy desserts too! The restaurant is clean, airy and still look the same as before; just simple and casual. I would still come back here and even bring our visiting friends and families from out of State ;))

This place is awesome for more than one reasons
1) Sushi!! Salmon was great tasting. All the ingredients were fresh. Rice tasted great. Everything was made with care and very neatly crafted
2) workers there works! They are walking between tables like bullet trains. I really appreciated how clean the installation were. And it had good vibrant atmosphere.
3) Varieties of veggies. Jicama salad was very refreshing. Hijiki reminded me of home. Silver noodle salad was bit too greasy for me, but it still was good.
4) Dessert!!! I mean, those bite size cakes, cream puffs, apple pie. And matcha ice cream!!! Yes!!!

I am definitely going back and recommending this place to anyone who is craving good Japanese food ( hear it from a Japanese woman ;) )

My family of four always have good time with Makino LV. The food is delicious and service is good. We started to visit Makino about 5 years ago and we actually visited Makino every time when we were in Las Vegas. Personally, I like their fresh and tasty salmon sushi and Tonkotsu ramen. My wife really enjoy their Japanese style appetizers. And my two kids like almost everything in this restaurant. Highly recommended .

AMAZING SUSHI BUFFET! If you are ever in the Vegas area...skip the Strip sushi all you can eat buffets. This is place is where you should definitely check out. The sushi rolls are not your typical fair of sushi rolls. Everything I had was delicious!

Really good and fresh sushi. Love the salad bar as well as the ramen too! Service was good. 
Haven't try dinner yet but sure will check it out further time.

Buffett at Makino has been cheaper than Todai's. Regarding the ever-increasing cost, Makino "only" increased a modest 2 dollars in 3 years. Today we six here to celebrate a reunion and all received senior discounts. (to be exact, $16 each for the lunch).
Sushi/Rolls/Nigiri, Shrimp tempura, baked Mussel, grilled Salmon, Calamari legs/steak, Sukiyaki/Teriyaki Beef, Udon/Ramen, etc. all here and all taste good.  Not available at lunch were Sashimi, Snow Crab legs, Scallop, Baked/Fried Oyster, and baked Clam. (believed they were included at dinner menu). Miso soup,  made from a "soup dispenser machine", still is tasteless. "Ramen" was a gimmick: it's there only because it had to be. Drink was not "free" (Sake was from $3~$5). Sushi/Rolls/Nigiri were very creatively made. Desserts? Marvelous! But with limited choice.
Service was very responsive and cordial.
Lots of variety and friendly service, the quality is real good for the price. Try the desserts.
Love it, the food is so delicious, they have crab leg, and all good seafood, alot of jummy sushi and dessert. We will come back here for next time Vegas.

I have to say that I really love buffets in general and this one is pretty dang good. There's a wide selection of sushi from good to bad ones. However, there's so many that you're bound to find something that you'll like. If sushi is not your thing, there are also other options as well that are so so. 

When you come here, expect nothing spectacular, but expect to be full and happy!

First time visiting this restaurant in Vegas. We arrived 20 minutes before the place opened and there was already a line of 2 dozen people. It's very crowded and people will cut in the sushi line so be prepared for this behavior. Also, you take your chances on sushi because there is no signage so you really don't know what you're eating. All in all, nice selection of sushi, tempura, desserts, and other traditional Japanese foods. Made the mistake of filling up on about a dozen sushi before trying other options. If you're looking for a nice variety of Japanese foods this is the place to try! Skip the salad and carb options, go for traditional fare first or you will feel full quickly.

All the food is good. Sushi is fresh. Large variety of food. 

Dessert: Chocolate fountain, variety of ice cream (including green tea), green tea cheesecake, crepes (made to order), assorted fruit, flan, and mango cake!
Good tonkatsu ramen. There was a large selection of sushi. Light on the hot entrees though

What a awful place for dining!! I visited with friends for dinner. We started our food with sushi and sashimi. there are lot of choices of sushi but it's all about rice with little fish. They just try to fill you up with rice. about the sashimi, the slice are not even, look like overnight dead fishes lay on spot light.

15 minutes later, the waitress came. She told us we have 15 minute more to eat.They will be closed in half hour. Why is nobody say anything before we be seated? Continue the good, we think a nice hot soup may warm my heart a little. Guess what, they are not even warm.....

When the check comes, it's 15% gratuity added automatically. With the bad service, bad good and cold soup. I have to pay extra 15% for thanking them robbed me? what's a nightmare. jc

Not bad for lunch wish I didn't come super hungry because I got full fast as I'm typing this I'm resting my stomach so I can get dessert .waited out side for 30 min cuz this place gets full fast.they open for lunch at 11:30 anyways would love to bring the whole family next time I will return

I walked in and saw all the sushi and I knew dinner was going to be good. I am no expert on sushi but everything I tried was good. I could probably pick food with my eyes closed and still be happy. All the other food (desserts, crab, clams, muscles...) were good too. The place was busy but the staff was quick and attentive. The price for dinner is a little too expensive for me but I will definitely be back for lunch. 

To Andrew J who made the comment about the chefs I did notice that the sushi chefs were Hispanic and speaking Spanish but It wasn't loud or distracting. I feel it isn't fair to the restaurant that you gave them a lower rating for that reason. While I was there one customer asked one of the chefs for a specific roll and he was nothing but friendly and quick to complete her request. I think its a little racist to demand Asian sushi chefs to consider the food good. I also doubt you would have noticed or cared if the chefs were Vietnamese or from some asian country other than Japan. Cooking good food depends on skill and quality of ingredients not ethnicity. Anyone can cook any style of food regardless of ethnic background.

The rice comes up from a rotating machine and the chef puts the fish on it. I have to admit that the rice was a bit tough and undercooked. But I still love the variety and the quality for the buck. Lunch for $17 is the best deal. I went by myself and was able to enjoy it on my own pace... All 5 plates full. I always leave feeling satisfied.
Do not come here on a Saturday afternoon unless you are prepared to wait for a long time. Otherwise the food is pretty decent.
Can't go wrong with any dish at this place, we tried just about every sushi roll and everything else. Great taste and nice selection

Service is pretty good here and there is a good selection of sushi. I also saw fried oysters, mussels and crab legs. I think they also have a ramen/noodle station and a hand roll station (limit 2 per person per order). While the sushi selection was good, and they also had nigiri, the fish wasn't very fresh, especially the tuna. The rolls tasted like ones that you can buy at Costco or smiths which is unfortunate. They also tended to put a lot of cream cheese in their some of their rolls. I did enjoy the salmon nigiri and eel nigiri. My bf ate about 4 plates of their crab legs. I was surprised that they had glass noodles and Kim chi, but both weren't very good. 

They also have a very small selection of desserts and I thought drinks would be included but soft drinks are $1.75 extra. The servers are really good at refilling your drinks. 

The place does get packed.... we arrive at 6 and by 7, it was completely full. Dinner pricing was $28.95 which is on the expensive side considering AYCE sushi spots offer a better selection and better quality. Also, with so many buffet options on the strip (and off strip), I probably won't be back.

Makino Sushi and Seafood is one of those places you go for large selections of sushi.  Don't be fooled. When you see the restaurant from the outside it kind of looks like a place with a little ambiance and when you walk inside the restaurant is big, bright and open with long counters that have sushi, tempura, BBQ and desserts. The place gets crowded in a hurry and that's because it's a great bang for the buck. I'm not talking large quantities of cheap food, the sushi you get here is good quality and lots of it. You want nigiri tuna you'll get nice large slices of tuna. And everything is fresh. This is the second location we have been to. The first time was at an outlet mall.  Makino is our family's favorite restaurant to go to.  You won't be disappointed.

Been coming to Makino since I was a teen. Definitely love the food! If you are a fan of Japanese food, come here! They offer many variety of sushi, salad, and more. The best part is always at the end when you try the desserts. The desserts looks very fancy and D E L I C I O U S! They have mini chocolate fountain, many variety of ice cream to choose from, fruits, and cakes. It is pricey but definitely worth it.

Very good quality Asian foods compare with surroundings Lots Asian restaurants. The price is very good too...

The service is very good ! Many nice Japanese ladies are carrying their customers here...

This is one QUALITY A.Y.C.E. Japanese seafood buffet!  Makino is a favorite of our local fams and it got some major props by my yelp buddies Sarah Marie D. & Henry C.  HAW-LLLA!!!  Only a short distance from The Las Vegas Strip, it's off Flamingo Rd.  Food 4 Less is the main player in the strip mall it holds court in.  Not much night lights  to help with the visuals, so just cruise to the north end and you'll find it.  The joint is PACKED with Asian folk of ALL ages, so MUST be bringin' it right to keep the masses happy.  Our attendants were pretty good at keeping the drinks full and limiting the plate piles.  So with unlimited access, we sampled a few things...

I'm definitely in agreement with the yelpers that say Makino food quality is a MAJOR step up from Todai, IF you have to compare it to something.  I've had many an Asian buffet in my journey, and this is the best BUFFET sushi quality so far, with an impressive selection.  The chicken, beef, and pork options were all tasty and tender.  The fresh seafood options (oysters, crab legs, fish & shrimp) were always well stocked.  The tempura options were all crunchy yummy.  You're offered a  dessert zone that is Asian influenced and all delicious.  You can also do the chocolate fountain thang and get your hearts content of 6 ice cream options.  YUMMY!!!

Oh man, we all left STUFFED!  I was one HAPPY Chubba Bubba fur sure :) Prices are VERY reasonable, especially for the quality of food that is prepared here.  This is easily something we would come back to, and could recommend to anyone looking for a Japanese buffet in Las Vegas.

Just so you know, they take reservations for parties of 8 or more.  Enjoy!

Alright!!! Not a huge sushi fan - but - my wife loved it!!! Didn't think I could get $26 worth of food (I eat veggie rolls with lots of wasabi). They had steak - real tender and cooked medium rare. Also Chicken teriyaki, and some chicken kabobs with red bell pepper that were delish! Everything looked REAL FRESH, salads were good - MISO was excellent!!! Most of these buffet style places have cheapo desserts - NOT HERE - Real Creme Brulet, the green tea ice cream was excellent! They had other stuff I didn't try (too full). You WILL find a couple desserts you will like. Veggie rolls were very good and the wasabi was HOTT!!! Wife thought her meal would cost about $100 at a good sushi place - VERY PLEASED!!! Can't give it a five star because I'm not a sushi, pork, shellfish eater. Hot green tea was also excellent (and I know green tea - this was close to my personal favorite "Novus Dragon Well Green") This place is saved in our GPS for the next trip to Vegas!!!

Makino's !!!! Used to be so good , what happened ? The prices have gone up . Which still isn't bad for all the food and sushi they offer but the rolls are a little weird and the nigiri comes with way too much rice and thin pieces of fish . 

The cooked food however is very good . My favorite was the cooked cod fish it was really good with rice and steamed veggies . 

All in all I ate my money's worth so I was happy (:
Incredible sushi selection. So fresh as their turnover is sooo quick EVERYTHING is insanely fresh, crispy, firm, etc. I need a couple of extra stomachs.
We love Makinos! They have the freshest sashimi (tuna) and crab legs. Love it! They have a great variety of different sushi and other meats. Best ayce Japanese food!

$30 for a seafood buffet off the strip. Over price for food that is very subpar. Sushi looked like it was sitting there for days. Our whole group came here for seafood and they were very disappointed. This is our third visit here and quality has gotten worse each time. My wife had a stomach that night so I have to vent.  I usually don't post such negative reviews unless it's totally warranted. Never coming back.

Came here for lunch was craving some AYCE sushi.  2 people for lunch came out $45.

Sushi was good. Tuna was reloaded by workers constantly.

The grilled food was ok. Nothing real special. There was also ramen and udon.
Great selection of tasty food, clean, reasonably priced with pretty good service. Can't ask for more than that at a buffet.
family has been coming here for years for lunch hour, but experienced dinner for the first time-had crab legs! super yum!

Meh, there are so many better Japanese buffets out there. The sushi here was not good at all and the rolls looked more or less the same--lots of fake crab meat and ahi. My highlight was that the dessert aisle had some really good creme brûlée. 

Oh, and FYI, I noticed a sign on their door saying they're closing this location sometime early in 2014.

It's a 10 minute drive from the Wynn area and an Uber can take you there with no problem. The wait for my large group of 10 people was only about 25 minutes and we managed to get seated and start eating pretty quickly. The food selection was pretty decent. Some of the sushi lacked some flavor, like the regular maguro tuna, and some of the others were a bit slimier than they should have been (squid). Nevertheless, for an all-you-can-eat Japanese buffet, the sushi was surprisingly decent (sushi/sashimi buffets generally never end well with me). The ramen bar was actually also surprisingly decent - I tried their tonkotsu ramen and udon and they were both pretty great. I would try to skip out on some of the maki rolls that aren't worth your dollar (california rolls - why?) and just go get yourself a hand roll instead.

The only way I can think of to describe Makino LV is to compare it to the chain of Todai asian buffet restaurants.  The quality is siimilar (which means good), this Makino is about half the size of any Todai place I have been to (and I have been to several), and the selection of dishes is also about half the variety of Todai's.  The cost is a bit less than Todai.  All in all, if you want to avoid the hustle of a Todai (which are usually situated in a busy area of a down-town), then come here by all means.

Nice friendly place that works like a well oiled clock. I am not big on sushi but this place is worth a try. All kinds sushi available and other stuff too. Pretty much everything is fresh(or taste fresh) and look good too. I had a blast and so all my fiends who came here regularly. I definitely recommend this place!
Their other location on Grand Central is a lot nicer. Cooked food is okay. Sushi is okay. Service is good. For about the same price, my preference is Todai's in PH instead of Makino's.
I love Makino. The seafood tasted very fresh and well worth the price I paid for dinner.

I was really excited about coming this restaurant, but was quickly let down before I even arrived at the place.  My reservation was at 6:45pm, the hostess called me at 6:30 saying they were giving up my table because I was not there!  I was right down the street and had to yell saying that I'd be there in less than 5 minutes.  She was not friendly when I arrived.

The restaurant was extremely crowded!  I had the first table, right next to the buffet line.  It was so crowded people were crowding my table and leaning on the back of my chair!  They were constantly watching me eat.  The service did not provide enough plates and cutlery for everyone in the place to eat.  I had to wait 10 minutes for a plate every time I stood up.

Other than the atmosphere, the food was alright.  Not much variety, but I was satisfied by what they had.  The ramen was the best part of the buffet.  On a more positive note, I absolutely loved the dessert bar!  It would please anyone with a sweet tooth.

Excellent variety of Sushi to choose from. I really enjoyed the Teriyaki chicken it was tasty and tender' also excellent crab roll among other sushi rolls I ordered excellent and quick service. 
Looking Foward Ordering ALL YOU CAN EAT Again!

Probably the best all you can eat sushi place I've ever been to! Don't get me wrong, I'd rather sit down and ask a chef for a fresh roll any day of the week,  but as far as sushi buffets go, I really liked it here. 

The sushi rolls are and meant to be taken one or a few pieces each so you can try a bunch of different ones and come back for more. The cooked food isn't 2nd banana either. My favorite was the squid, which was cut up into rings and surprisingly tender. Also, the crab was really good, I don't think they freeze it because the meat stayed together so well and it was freaking tasty. There's other items like noodles, rice, meats, and desserts, but the winner for me was the sushi and seafood. 

There's a lot of choices on the strip but this place has better sushi and seafood compared to other more elegant restaurants on the strip. Take the short drive because it really is worth it!

Japanese buffet in Vegas started with Makino. The regular buffet where all dishes are out and you just pick what you like. 

They charge $25 for dinner. The fish quality at Makino is not very good. For their sashimi, the fish cuts were of low grade and the color Of the tuna was very pale. Their rolls are all very saucy and the fish in it tends to be soggy too.

Their desserts are not bad though and the service was pretty good. That's where the 3 stars are for. They have a good selection of desserts. 

A quick note, if you are celebrating a birthday at Makino, be sure to mention that when you arrive to your server as they will make a special cake for the celebrant.

We go to Las Vegas over our Thanksgiving holidays and always meet up with all of my fiance's family at Makino. They never have a problem accommodating our large group (40+ people). The family is Japanese and this is a Japanese buffet. .. that is enough testament for me. I really enjoy the all-you-can-eat maki and sushi. Others also like the crab legs, udon, chocolate fountain and ice cream bar.

I came here against my better judgment after reading the reviews and only because the group I was with insisted.  

The food was mediocre, the cooked foods were extremely greasy.  The sushi rolls were not how you would normally find them, for example the tempura roll had cream cheese.  Say what?  It's my favorite roll that I get at every Japanese restaurant I go to and it did not look right.  And I could not find the steamed rice.  When I finally asked, the lady told me it was behind the counter.  Why would anyone think to look there and serve themselves?

My husband, father and I each had exactly one plate of food and then we couldn't stomach anymore.  I think what turned me off was when my husband told me there was hair in a bowl he had grabbed.  

Two thumbs down.  

I will definitely not be frequenting this place.

We saved this sushi buffet for our last night in Vegas. Thank God because the next night I didn't feel very well. The next morning I had the Sh!t's with a temperature of 102. I had a horrible day! I really do feel that this place played a part of my stomach flu. 

We went when it opened at 5:30pm thinking everything will be fresh. I think the food was sitting for a few hours while they prepped for opening. Sushi wasn't fresh at all! I knew it from the moment I put that crap in my mouth! If you do visit this restaurant, go at a later time when they refresh the buffet.

This place was the best seafood buffet I've been to, a must go in addition to Vegas buffets at the big hotels. 

35 bucks out the door and there was a small line forming about 10 minutes before open for dinner. They were nice about splitting the check a billion different ways. 

There's tons of sushi options but I focused on the sashimi and hand rolls. The sashimi was quite good if not amazing, while the hand rolls were delicately prepared. 

You can avoid eating the rice here, but people hid rice under Oyster shells anyway...did I mention the raw oysters were good? 

They also had crab legs and a good deal of hot food that was good, Asian stuff with a highlight on the kebabs. Udon and miso soup were pleasant as well.

Well worth the price!
great selections! price very reasonable, kids love the choices especially the ramen (made to order)ice cream is the best!

I was pleasantly surprised to find an all-you-can-eat place where the quality is pretty good. For lunch it was $16.95/person which I felt was a pretty good deal considering the choices.

Don't expect to see sashimi. They want you to eat the sushi and fill up on the rice! There's a bevy of choices though and you'll also have a chance to fill up on tempura, 3 kinds of salad and some hot dishes too.

The only thing lacking I felt was the desserts. There's a chocolate fountain which is kinda cool but the presentation of the fruits and marshmellows was mediocre. I know they're keeping costs down by just offering bananas to dip, but. there should be more variety of things to dip into the chocolate.
I've been going to the Makino Restaurant on Decatur for the past 4 months. Great sushi selection for a buffet and the cooked food is great too. Love the price and service. A+

Took a 3 hr drive from LA just to eat lunch here! Definitely the best Japanese buffet. Had to wait an hr for a seat but well worth the drive and time. Food was AMAZING!! The amount of options for the sushi was soooooo many that I had to try them all!
AMAZING food. It's truely the bombdotcom!!!!!!! Oh and did i mentioned it's only $26.99 per person?!?!?

I love this place!!! They have great sushi (a huge variety) and lots of yummy hot dishes! I particularly like the fact that they keep their tempura shrimp display well-stocked!  I'm always thrilled that they replenish the salmon frequently.
