- Presentation of sushi was appetizing. Good selection of nigiri, never an empty tray.
- With the sushi, I like to get sides of the 2 types shrimp tempura to add an extra crunch.
- I did enjoy the mussels, udon, and spicy ramen. 
- Dessert selection was more presentable. I recommend the green tea cake. 
- Not as packed as last time. No crazy hungry animals pushing and shoving.

It was pretty good- the self-service dessert bar was unkept but like people say the green tea ice cream is the real star. Sushi was mostly good but some
Of it a little dried out. Lunch is a good value and drinks might be the cheapest buffet prices around. Staff is a little pushy about paying up before you are done eating if close to closing time so that was a little disruptive, but overall
We enjoyed.

When I first discovered sushi 5 years ago I thought this place was amazing. After broadening my horizons and trying places like Yama Sushi, my perception of this place became a little more grounded in reality. The sushi wasn't great but what could you expect from a 15 dollar buffet style sushi place? At least it had its place.

Last night I went back with a friend for old times sake and realized how far downhill this place had gone. It was the first time I've ever been flat out disgusted by the poor quality of the sushi. Every piece I got was rubbery with a sickening smell of fish hanging around it. After the miserable failure I endured with the sushi on the first plate, I decided to stick to the cooked items. They had gone downhill too: just the same lukewarm mediocre tripe you can get from any 10 dollar chinese buffet. Even the desert plate managed to be a disappointment with the ice cream heavily freezer burned. 
Near the end of my meal I thought at least the blow wouldn't be as hard as if I went to a bad sushi place: there was that 15 dollar price tag, much cheaper then a sushi bar. And that's when the final insult of the night came: the price for this garbage had increased to 25 dollars a diner so I could have just as easily gone to a great sushi bar, loved my food and gone home satisfied. Instead, I left feeling sick and vaguely like I had been robbed.

Don't go to this place people, there are better options. If you want sushi, go to Yama Sushi, Sushi Bomb, Sushi Twister, Sushi Kai or Sushi Mon. All are good and except for Twister and Bomb they're cheaper then Makino too. If you're less of a sushi fan but still want an asian buffet, do Buffet@Asia on Sahara and Rainbow. It has a small sushi section, the cooked food is better and its under 20 bucks for dinner. If not that then go for any other asian buffet and get the same quality of food for half the price.

good place to try some fresh sushi as well as other japanese delicacies.  its a buffet... one side of the room is sushi sashimi and specialty rolls. in the middle u have the salads and cold veggies...on the left u have everyhing from king crab legs to oysters to fresh tempura and udon noodle bowls.  to top off the gluttony u have a desert bar with freshly made crepes...a chocolate fountain with fresh fruit.. and freshly scooped ice creams like cream tea and coffee....
this place. The sushi is always fresh. I tried to come here at least once a month. It is my favorite place for AYCE buffet. The service is excellent
really cheap sushi buffet . AYCE. i feel some of those rolls r a little too salty. but hey that price u can not beat at 20.39 per person not including tips
Excellent food quick service the shrimp tempura was awesone. It does get busy so be prepared for a crowd.
Great selection and options - love all the rolls they have. Got a bunch of made to order handrolls - my fave. Took away a star since I wish they had some less carb/rice options like sashimi.

This is THE worst buffet I have ever been to.  I wanted to go to Todai, but they were closed, so, we had no choice because thus was the only place my friends remembered.  Five of us went for lunch Saturday 06/04/16 and we all got FOOD POISONING.
I didn't eat much of the sushi, because it didn't look so fresh... so, I only had the diarrhea,  but some of my friends ate double of what I ate and they were bad...and one friend ate more than what we did and she was the WORST.  
We had to drive back to L.A. that night and she was out of it...Couldn't stay awake, high fever, throwing up, diarrhea, headache....it's the worst.
It was ridiculous....
On our drive back home, we had to stop several times...
NEVER EVER going back there again.
If I could, I would give this place -10.

I'm the opposite of a hater and never wrote a Yelp review however I must warn people about this place I came in on a Sunday and waited 15mins to be seated the sushi looked like it was sitting out for a long period of time . With a packed house you would think it would be fresh . When I walked up to get my sushi it was a bee hovering around the sushi with cooks just looking at it . After 15 minutes of eating I see a roach crawling up by my girls face she immediately jumped up and ran out . PLEASE BE CAREFUL !!!!!

my irish buddy and i came by here since it was still lent and we weren't in the mood for Filet-o-Fish. a litle pricey for lunch, i thought, at $18. food was good though. lots of options. lots of sushi especially. the tempura veggies and shrimp were yummy. may just come back next year if we don't find a less expensive spot. 

oh, and be advised, cab drivers don't stop by here to get you.

We've been coming here for AYCE sushi for a long time.  It's been painted at least five times, and the line up for the menu has changed at least that many times as well.  It seems they are always adding to it.  And there are new takes on sushi often.  

But it seems that quality is slipping just a bit, and doesn't seem to be as fresh.  We have come in at different times and on different days but it seems that it's hit or miss.  Still overall, I enjoy it for a quick sushi fix, but my husband and I are starting to explore other places!

Sushi, crab legs, sushi , crab legs. Did I mention that I LOVE cheap (relatively) sushi. We ate here on the second night in Vegas, yes, this was the first glutton fest of the week. 
The price is right.... $26.95
The sushi was fantastic
The crab legs, although small, were very tasty.
The stuffed shrimp were excellent. 
The staff were friendly
There was ICE CREAM !!!

Compared to the Makino in Hawaii?  Smaller, cheaper , tons of parking, NO LINE and far less crowded. GREAT EXPERIENCE

Food was good but we went right at 5pm. Everything was fresh and good except the crab legs....as always too salty and mushy (Prob from freezing and unfreezing over and over again). I am always disappointed! Suggestion: serve it steamed it will taste better and Prob seem
More fresh. Desserts kinda going downhill too, there is always a grouchy person scooping the ice cream (or not since most times you have to ask someone to do it).  No strawberries or dipping items for chocolate sauce...not even sponge cake....just mini marshmallows! Overall not worth $66! They also don't have cut Teri steak anymore it's like slices of roast beef or some kind of meat.  Meh...Prob be a while till we go back again...

Be prepare to wait at least 30 mins - 1 hour depending on the day and time. Sushi is mediocre at best. Mostly Mexican workers that just keep pumping out tasteless sushi. Definately not worth the money and the hype. They used to have 3 locations in Las Vegas but now only the original store is open. I wonder why??

Visited Vegas on a family and friends trip. With the large group had to try out the buffet that seemed to be popular. The wait was pretty long, even on a weekday lunch the day after thanksgiving. The views inside were nice as expected in Vegas, the waitresses were pretty cute. The sushi was just ok, typical nigiri selections with fish that was better than the buffets I've had before but subpar to a normally sushi joint. The tonkatsu Ramen was pretty decent though, had a couple bowls with the wife and kid. The selection of non sushi was decent, fresher than I would expect from a buffet, probably because of the high turnover with the high volume of people. There was a dessert selection as well with many flavors of ice cream. 

Overall a good bargain being a buffet and better than average quality of food. But in Vegas I expect more, having visited some of the higher end sushi joints and other restaurants I like to be blown away versus what I can get at home. Wasn't blown away by this place.

Yelp's 365 Review Challenge 2014 #288 - #365

We were staying at Encore and they decided to eat at Makino  AYCE dinner because it was cheaper than eating on the strip, especially at Encore. Located about 10 minutes from the strip in a mediocre area of Vegas. I don't know the price per head because I didn't pay, Woot! 

This isn't just any kind of buffet but a Japanese Buffet. It was just average and the sashimi didn't taste fresh at all and I'm glad I didn't try to beef because several people in our party got food poisoning! they did have a great selection of sushi rolls and most of them had a lil too much rice and less fish. I would come back to give it another try.

I have to say I really enjoyed this place but the reason why I didn't give it 5 Stars waw many reasons here they are listed below...

1 - The steamed white rice is hard to find it's tucked away behind the desserts close to the restrooms so you will get a smell of the bathrooms before you eat

2- My first time coming here was a holiday specifically Mother's Day they had Lobster I assume they always had Lobster nope only on some holidays ( they didn't have it on Easter) and it's only half a lobster and you only get one which is through a ticket system 

3- I'm a big cheesecake fanatic I have noticed the recipe has changed. Their new recipe has Shortcake crust which is not as good. 

4- The woman behind the ice cream counter seem to be having a rough day and was taking it out on us the customers sometimes she'll give you two flavors if you ask (they come in small plastic cups) we saw another person did not get two cups when they asked politely. So she was very picky on who gets what and how many types of ice.

Now for the good...

Their clams are excellent they're in a soup broth and unlimited amounts of the sushi selection is fantastic! Always a good amount of crab legs, the claws are pre-cut for easy opening and they provide the aluminum silver crackers too. 

If you're not into seafood there is a large selection of meats such as short rib BBQ, baby back ribs, and chicken skewers

There's a miso soup machine! Fresh Udon too!

Fair selection of deserts and a chocolate fondue fountain.

Huge line outside when they open at 5:30 p.m. however the small restaurant does a great job of squeezing everybody in with enough tables for everyone and short wait time. I would also give this place five stars if they increased their hours and was open longer for their lunch/dinner times.

Family of 4 and one kid (who was under 4ft and if over 5ft pays a slightly higher rate) cost $180.00 dinner rate without tip. If you have a party of over 8 people you should make a reservation. No Reservations are needed if less than that. All in all good customer service buy all the waiters and when you need to pay everything is quick and easy.

I don't write many reviews, but this place deserved one.  For an affordable price - this buffet exceeded my expectations.  The food quality was excellent, the sushi was very fresh, so were the hot foods.  And the desserts were amazing! Would definitely go there again and recommend to friends!
My family and I went here for Father's Day and the food was not as tasteful as I thought it'd be. The only thing that was good was the service. Our server was so kind. But I would not come back
The day we went, there were a few new sushi  items to us. We don't frequent as much as before but everytime we've gone it's been excellent .

So, they have a website that says they do to go patters and that you can customize them.  Apparently that is not true. You can just order from a list of 3 sushi platters and that is all.  I wanted to order the big platter and add a bunch of extra separate rolls but apparently that is not possible. The reason is they don't have prices for rolls to go.  Yet they sell these rolls in their restaurant.  Bizarre.  They don't want people to order more food and spend more money.

Ah, Makinos. 12 years ago when their location at the north outlets still existed...it was our fave place to "splurge" on. All you can eat sushi including hot food, salads, soups, desserts, etc...the sushi always seemed to be the best value you'd get for the price.

We have been to the Decatur location a few times now and each time it has been such a party to get into. I find this place a little too fitted. Not as spacious and when it is busy, it's like a circuit to walk through. I started to feel the decline in their sushi, especially, at the outlet location before they closed...but after frequenting this location...I really really am feeling it. You can see the age in the sushi as it sits, rice has been a bit old, and I can't stand the cross contamination. You know when one tong has been used for different sushis. Which may not be a big deal...but when someone is using one tong for one sushi then the same one for another...people with allergies could suffer from this easily from those who aren't conscious to such things. 

While I do know that the price you pay for the options you get isn't so bad...because I've seen this place years ago, and with all the ayces out there...this place wouldn't be it for us/me. I'd rather pay about the same price for a place that specializes specifically on sushi rather than one that tries to carer to everyone's preference...because quite frankly, there are those who want sushi and then another person in their party doesnt. I feel like this place works best for such situation. 

On that note, despite what I feel...I'd recommend them if whatever I typed makes sense to you. They had a working high chair when I was there but please leave the stroller in the trunk because it gets crazy busy in there and space gets limited.

Enjoy!

This place is a pretty decent sushi buffet. They have an array of sushi rolls to choose from. Some of the rolls are packed with rice though but still tasted pretty good. They also had udon and miso soups that you can make yourself. They have a $16.99 deal during the weekdays, which is a pretty good deal. The service was okay and the waitstaff seemed to be adding a chaotic atmosphere because they kept running back and forth from the dining area and kitchen. The place could have been a bit cleaner because there was rice almost everywhere and there weren't enough serving tongs for the food, so that was kind of a mess. This wouldn't be my first choice to dine here but I wouldn't mind coming back.

Easily 5 stars. 

I came here on a Sunday around 1 or so. I was seated quickly and quickly grabbed a plate and started looking at the selection. They have several roll options, lots of nigiri, and hot food options as well as dessert. The sushi is amazing, the hot dishes mostly meh, and the deserts were okay as well. For about $20 a person you can get all you can eat sushi and it is pretty good quality sushi. Minus one star for the meh non-sushi items.

Makino is fine for what it is.  I sometimes stop by here and get a take out box and just stuff the box with stuff.  It usually comes to like $10 or so which is fine.  But I don't like the idea of the sushi just SITTING there the whole time getting dry or whatever.  The sushi buffet places that make it to order are definitely a better way to go.  

Don't get me wrong though..I'll still eat these rolls if they're there.  I just think there are better choices out there for sushi buffets like Sushi Hana or even Sushi Factory.

BTW...Penn from Rio's "Penn and Teller" dines here for lunch quite often.  I've seen him there at least 4 times and I don't here that often for my takeout box.  You can't miss him.

One of atomic city's really good sushi buffets at a great price at under $36  aside from the fresh sushi there is the traditional teriyaki beef and chicken. they also have fried broiled and steamed seafood all the usual dishes you see at buffett's. the miso soup is excellent not too bitter just right. the one stand out is the dessert station really well prepared pastries and good quality cookies not the cheap kind they sell at the supermarket. my favorite is the ice cream not the usual soft serve machine but in the case where you haft to scoop it and who doesn't like to scoop ice cream. all in all a nice place to go to if your craving sushi with the buffet atmosphere.

I'm not a huge fan of sushi, but this place has plenty of other options.  To be honest, I wasn't always sure what I was eating, but it was delicious.  There was a beautiful green salad that appeared to be noodles, but was actually seaweed.  There was also a good black seaweed salad.  The combination of jicama and mango was also unusual and delicious.  There were chicken, pork ribs, roast beef, tempura shrimp and vegetables, soups, and loads of deserts- basically, something for everyone.
Came to this place comparing to Todai. Not bad at all and much less cheaper. The sushi selection was pretty good but my wife and I really like their Pork Tonkotsu Ramen. Delicious!

As all you can eat sushi / asian food buffets go i really must say this is the best one i've come across.  Its WAYYY better than Todai and basically the same price.  So if you're in LV go to the all you can eat asian buffet that asians actually go to.

Great food, fresh,..friendly & great service !!!..Been here many times,...The food is still good but no more oysters ..One of the best buffets ever,.the sushi is like an explosion of flavor...excellent pricing make this place amazing...Also the location is great, close to the strip.This place is worth a try!

Admittedly I don't like sushi, but my friend does so I agreed to go with him for lunch. The non sushi items were all pretty bad. They were mostly cold, the beef was really chewy, and the chicken was dry. They had a lot of sushi items, but my friend said that the sushi wasn't even that good either. A lot of better options if you want sushi, seafood, or a buffet

This is a connundrum for me.  Normally I don't like the all you can eat oriental buffet because the food is not fresh, people are messy and the food gets all mixed together and the variety is limited.  That said, this may be the best All you can eat oriental buffet I have been to.  It has a great layout, plenty of creative sushi dishes, and they really take pride in their freshness and cleanliness.  The tuna was perfectly fresh and the calamari was excellent.  Their hot dishes were good too.  They even had a chocolate fountain for the sweet tooth.  The good thing about these places is you can try many different kinds of sushi instead of being limited to 4-8 pieces of each.  The trade-off is you don't get as many special roll choices and you can't ask them to make one just for you.  Still, it was a pleasant surprise and my wife is awesome for finding it!

Update. I downgraded this to 3 stars.  The last time we went was not so good. The sushi was messy, and the hot food was not refreshed quickly.  It was busier than the last time and maybe they had trouble keeping up.

My family somewhat likes this place so we come here quite often when we visit Las Vegas.

For a supposedly sushi- and sashimi- oriented place, the sushi and sashimi is about the same or worse as I can buy in a good Japanese supermarket.

As for the hot food, some of it wasn't very hot at all. I picked up some fried oysters that had just been put out and nearly gagged when I ate it, because it was at room temperature and just a soggy piece of grease.

The tempura shrimp is always good though, and the crab legs as well.

Now my biggest gripe - the green tea ice cream. Yes it's good, the problem is I've been here four times and they've run out twice. I'm also pretty sure they either intentionally don't bring out more from the back or intentionally don't order enough to satisfy demand. If they keep being so cheap and greedy I don't anticipate coming back.
Amazing service, fresh sushi all the time. All you can eat and fills you up! Amazing food for people who don't enjoy sushi and people who love sushi. 100% recommend. The dessert is also amazing!

Just came to this fantastic all-you-can-eat sushi bar for the second time.

The assortment  of sushi chichi me and other appetizers is outstanding. Everything was fresh well presented.  It's fun being Las Vegas and not having to be in the rush of the Boulevard.

It gets the job done in terms of having a nice selection. Some items are better than others. I don't think of coming here when I think buffet or sushi, but my family enjoyed it. 

Wait staff is attentive, which I appreciated since I don't usually see that at a buffet. Ample parking and not too far from the strip.

I would go again, if invited. My personal preference: I LOVE PAPAYA and they had some available and it was delicious!
yes good place. lots of choices. fast and alot of room to sit

It's always became a traditional brunch for me and family to go to Makino mostly every month now. This buffet is my parents favorite spot for sushi and they would never try anything else. The lunch price for the buffets is about $19.95 per person. They have a sushi bar where you can make your own wraps of sushi and ramen bar. Not to mention the dessert section you can get your own shave ice. 

The food they serve isn't your typical asian buffet but they have really good authentic asian food to serve. My favorite is the shrimp tempura. The sushi is pretty fresh and the sushi rolls pretty much all taste the same but I'm not complaining. Really get your money's worth but this place is mostly for a family gathering rather than a date scenery. Been going here since it open, because it's my parents favorite.

My family and I used to frequent the Makino in the Premium Outlet Mall on Charleston a looong time ago. We stopped going mainly because it was just too expensive. Recently, my dad decided to give this place a try and we fell in love with it all over again.

Don't come in here with great expectations because I guarantee you that it will lead to just disappointment. Come to Makino without any expectations at all just like I did, haha!

The overall restaurant is kind of cramped. It's smaller compared to the one that they had at Premium. So that was a big thumbs down for me.

Service: They're okay. Some of the servers have a resting b!tch face. They just come to refill your drinks and take your food away. I'm probably really picky, but I like having servers who'll actually say "excuse me" while taking your food or I don't know.. People who'll actually smile?  

Food: There's a lot to choose from here. They have a lot of different kind of rolls and nigiri. If you come for dinner, they serve oysters, crab legs, amaebi (sweet shrimp) nigiri, and sashimi! They also have shrimp tempura, udon, seaweed salad, etc. I personally love the food selections here because they don't have a limit to amaebi nigiri. You can have as much as you want. And you can't find unlimited sashimi at an AYCE sushi restaurant. 

Price: Their dinner price here is comparable to AYCE sushi places in town (around $27). 

Personally, I find it worth every penny. You don't have to wait for the server to take your order, and you don't have to wait for your sushi rolls to come to your table. You can just get up and take ONE piece of roll that looks appetizing before getting more pieces. No more ordering half rolls or full rolls. And btw, they don't charge extra for leftovers ;)
Didn't know that they have ramen along with their wide selections of tasty food! Their sushi are just delish! Will come back here for sure.

So I'm not some sort of sushi connoisseur so I'm basically going off of, "well it tasted good to me" for this review.

Went here on 07/31/14 with Brian P. and his coworker. I left in probably the most painful food coma of my life. Why? Ceviche! It was absolutely delicious! I had to have multiple servings it was so tasty.

Personally, I much prefer this buffet style to regular AYCE places because I like to try a single piece of a lot of stuff, rather than a whole roll. I tried a piece that was just a tentacle of something on a square of rice. No idea what animal  the tentacle orignated from, but it was okay. No real flavor, and luckily not the texture I had imagined.

I tried a hand roll for the first time, it was heavy on the rice and the raw enoki mushrooms were strangely overpowering. Luckily, unlike AYCE places, as long as you're not visibly wasting vast quantities of food, peeling off some rice or leaving some things you don't like on your plate won't result in an extra charge on your bill.

I enjoyed pretty much everything I tried - which was like three plates worth of food. Desserts were really good and I especially like the coffee jello and what tasted like huapia.
Best place ever I went there for my b- day and it was awesome everything fresh and delicious, hope I have more time to go, awesome service for mall my family thanks!!!
Love everything about this place. Awesome sushi, all fresh food & very tasty ramen. Will definitely recommend this place.

The nigiri is ok here typical selections they did have something different and that was the beef nigiri, saba was good and the yellowtail was also. They had tuna sashimi and that was all right.  The tonkatsu soup was good as usual. The hot food was very salty on alot of the items.  I haven't been here in about a year probably won't be back for another year. There are better place for sushi but it's my wife place to eat sushi mainly its for the soup.

Wow, I LOVE this place!  I'd heard lots of good things about this place and been meaning to try it out but never got around to it.  But I just got back from lunch with the family, and the selection here is amazing!  And good quality too!  not too much rice, lots of fresh fish, and great dessert selection.  Kids loved the chocolate fondue!  I only wish I had left some room to try more of the dessert, but after all the other stuff, I was completely tapped out.  Friendly staff and great value.  Will totally come again whenever I'm in town.  You know, come to think of it, most Vegas buffet is totally outrageously priced now.  You can EASILY spend $40-$50 per person at other places.  Compared to that, Makino is still only about half the price, and way better quality when it comes to the Japanese/sushi/seafood category.  Especially with kids in tow, that could add up to pretty good savings.
This is a One of Kind Place! Everything is so Fresh & Tasty! The Selections are unique & Just to die for!

Amazingly fresh, huge variety, great service! Line forms outside about 15-30 minutes before opening time, just a heads up!

My family and I arrived at 11 am, doors open 11:30am. There were about 5 groups before us already in line. Servers were quick in getting everyone in and taking their drinks down. Food was already prepared and ready for everyone. Everything tastes very fresh, no complaints at all about the food. They have one section for sushi, one section for cooked foods (like ramen, fried rice, tempura, etc.) and then one section for dessert. Servers came by to refill our drinks very frequently, I was surprised at how on top of their game they were despite how busy it is! 

I was recommended to try this place from a friend and was not disappointed.

Good quantity of sushi selections. Just  the typical  sushi. NO special sushi though.  My husband said you can ask for your own roll. Food was good, desserts were ok. Didn't expect that much from it compared to the buffets on the strip. The ramen was good not the kind of ramen you get from ramen places but it's good. The server  was nice, she kept refilling my hot tea and soda. We paid 19.99 per person.  Worth it.

I was really craving for sushi while my bf was craving for hot food items, so we came across here. A win-win situation? 

We arrived an hour and a half before closing, the wait wasn't long at all. We were seated right away. 
Customer service was good. All the employees were really friendly and nice. The one server who said a medium size sake was a good size for my bf & I was wrong... (since we like to drink while eating). I wanted a large but she recommended a medium... anyways, on to the food....

Sushi - 2/5 
I'm a fan of nigiri. They had a wide range of nigiris, rolls & even hand rolls made to order! But this is a review on the nigiri only... quality was ok. Not the freshest or best sushi I ever had, but it is a buffet. Can't expect too much... haven't tried the other sushi items so can't say much about it.

Hot food items - 4.5/5
They had lots of hot food items. From made to order ramen, to tempura, roast beef & more. The selection was big! I liked pretty much everything. The food didn't taste bland at all. The winner was of course the snow crab legs!!! 

Dessert - 5/5
They also have a wide range of different cakes, also ice cream & a chocolate fountain! Way to go makino!!

I recommend this place if you have a big appetite but don't know what you're craving for and want a bit of everything. I would stay away from the sushi.... but go for everything else instead! Might be coming back to stuff my face with more crab legs!! YUMMM

I still can't believe I went to Makino's the first time ever back in September and I just recently went back on Black Friday.

The first time I came here, I honestly had NO idea what Makino's was. The only buffets I have ever been to are usually the ones that serve a while assortment of food, but this primarily focuses on Japanese food. So you can only imagine my excitement when I first walked in and saw the incredible display of sushi, especially my favorite: salmon nigiri. If you go at dinner, you can catch their crab legs, however, the quality of them is mediocre at best.

Besides sushi, Makino's has yakisoba, chicken teriyaki, ramen, miso soup, salad, mussels, shrimp tempura and more. Their dessert selection is okay. They do have a chocolate fondue foundation, so if chocolate is your thing then knock yourself out. Their cream puffs are okay, but I feel like they could be a TAD bit sweeter. That's a lot for me to say because I don't really like sweets that much. I do love their green tea ice cream. I feel like you can't go wrong with green tea ice cream.

All in all, I'm not that big a fan on buffets anymore. However, if I am being treated out or treating someone else out that loves buffets. This is by far the cheapest (yet better quality) option even if you go for their dinner menu because you get crab legs. If you're looking for good quality crab legs, then you might want to look somewhere else.

Makino's - This is a good sushi buffet. A lot of people know about this place and come often. I have heard some people complain that they were sick after eating here but I havn't had that problem. They have oysters and crab and everything. They have a large variety of rolls and sushi and sashimi's. The rolls are big, not your average buffet rolls... I wish they had uni, but they don't. They have a good selection of hot Japanese food as well.  They also have a chocolate fountain and a full icecream bar. This place is pretty decent and worth trying/going back.

Very popular place. They have variety of sushi & Japanese. One friend loved it even though she never liked eating raw fish before. We all enjoy the food and the price $30 per person was not bad either.
Food is great and even better than the one in Irvine, in my opinion. Seating is a little tight.

Came with my extended family tonight for dinner. Based on the abundance of uni sashimi, snow crab legs, and the vast assortment of other sashimi and sushi items, everything was so great for the price charged!

My wife says it's definitely more worth it than eating at the casino buffets. As for me, I only eat the cheap cooked goods, but the dessert selection was wonderful. My younger daughter,a true connoisseur of desserts, said she never encountered the wide selection of ice cream choices as available at Makino!

We usually go to the one by the outlets after a day of shopping, but found out that they've closed that one down! Thankfully Yelp pointed us to this location.

The wait for lunch was not too bad (~20 minute wait) given the amount of people there. Unfortunately there is no waiting room inside of the location, so we were standing out in the cold for a bit. They provide a small heater near the door, but it wasn't enough to keep the crowd of people warm. We didn't mind though- we were more hungry than cold. 

There's a nice variety of food to choose from with a bunch of different sushi to try! I'm not very fond of different types of sushi, so some labels would've been nice for sushi noobs like myself. But every one that I tried was delicious, so I didn't mind. I usually don't get noodles or fried rice at buffets, but they have a different, distinct taste when compared to your average Asian restaurant, and is definitely worth trying! The udon is quite tasty as well. The tempura goes quick, so definitely get it while it's fresh! The dessert selection is great and you can even get some ice cream on a cone to go!

Overall, it's a great place to eat and it's well worth the wait. I'll definitely be back whenever I'm in town!

We had came here on our last day.  We were just about to leave town when our friend, who also drove, told us to come here.  Apparently he's been coming here for ten years so we trusted him.

I usually skip buffets [although there's this all-u-can-eat Korean BBQ that's to die for in Chinatown!] since I don't eat my money's worth but I had no problem here.  Everything was fresh and refreshing.  I'm glad we came here for lunch.  Every time I went out for another plate [only three plates], there would be a new item.  It's quite exciting!

On the way out, I grabbed my second ice cream cone.  The first one was green tea.  My second one was red bean.  All that milk had me out like a lamp on the way home!

I will definitely come here again.  After all, I think my other friend wants to have her wedding reception here!

They had such a wide selection. My husband and I loved it. My nephew who was with us also enjoyed the selection. They had tempura shrimp, beef, pork, some tender and delicious ribs, a wide variety of sushi, cooked and raw. They had a sashimi salad that was yummy! I will def go back to this place.

We, party of 10 with 2 kids, walked in as soon as the doors open @ 5:30pm, ready for some fresh sushi, oysters, crab legs, shrimp and their fresh cooked food (great selection ;-). @ 25.95 a pop for dinner and price goes down by heighth for kids12 yrs and younger, 5ft or shorter has their prices and so on. Senior citizens discount too.
Anyhow, food was really good, at their sushi bar there were about 16 different types of creative sushi, all made with fresh ingredients , fresh oysters, crab legs, salads, in their made food section, the buffet offered about 10 different made dishes ranging from fried tempura to chicken & mushrooms but I only ate there baked prawns with a seafood melody sauce,  which was on point with flavors.  Last, I never made it to dessert, tapped out after 3 rounds, but the dessert section was filled with fruit, sweet goodies and ice cream.  
The servers were very good and fast at taking plates away and keeping drinks filled. This buffett is on the west side of the strip but worth the drive for a real good seafood, sushi, and japanese cooked food buffet. Our experience was fulfilling and fun. A buffet worth coming to.

I came in when it was opening time and I thought hey, it may be great! But when I tried the sushi, it wasn't that fresh. I believed they already prepared it hours before its open but some rolls were pretty good. They also have lots of different rolls and sashimi and nigiri. They serve hot food as well. It was a bit pricy but they had a lot of different things. They have crab legs and short ribs and ramen station and desserts with chocolate fountain. I've had better sushi buffet but this wasn't that bad.

18.95$ for lunch, the setting is tight, food is not as good as the one in the outlet(which was closed forever). Parking space is not easy to find.but overall value is still better than any other buffet in LV.

I've been to my fair share of sushi restaurants all over the country.  I've also been to many of the sushi style restaurants in Vegas. A friend of mine who lives in the area took me to Makino for lunch. Now, it is buffet style, which usually turns me off. However, this is the best forum for trying a number of different selections. The fish is incredibly fresh and the rice is cooked perfectly.  They also had a number of other selections for non sushi eaters as well. I really wanted to try the scratch made spicy ramen soup, but I was too full! Best of all was the price. $16.95 .  This is the least expensive meal that I've had while in Vegas and probably my favorite.,

Chinese people love buffets and Coach bags more than anything. 

This place has lots of tuna and salmon. The variety isn't Golden Corral, but its unique in that it's a sushi buffet, as opposed to an All You Can Eat Sushi Restaurant. There are a number of different rolls and some sashimi (shrimp, eel, salmon, tuna). But the rolls aren't particularly appetizing, it's more like a one and done. I didn't feel like eating a roll twice. I didn't see any baked rolls either. For this price, I can't really complain. Tip: If you wanna eat just the tuna or salmon, get the poke. It's more flavorful. 

The other food is surprisingly appetizing. The snow crab legs and pork ribs are good. They have green tea and strawberry ice cream. I'd recommend avoiding the green tea and snow cones, since they give you an entire bowl of ice for the snow cone. 

It sounds like I'm hating on this place a lot, but $20 for infinite crab legs is worth it by itself. The sushi and desserts are just icing on the cake.

For a buffet, it was pretty good. I can taste how fresh their food is and see employees make some of it fresh to order. For $28.95/adult on a Thursday night, I think that's a good deal given that it is mainly seafood and it's all-you-can-eat. There are only very few items that I disliked. I would come again and I recommend it.

PROS:
+ Sushi ("above average" to "good")
+ Other Seafood, like Shrimp Tempura and Prawns
+ Dessert is bomb, especially the green tea ice cream
+ Free parking in the plaza
+ Friendly service & Attentive 

CONS:
× May have a higher risk of cross-contamination because they leave out the tongs for 1-3 different food items 
× Seating is kinda terrible, but it is a buffet. The tables are cramped together, so people sitting with their chairs out doesn't help. You're bound to run into a couple of people.

To be honest, if I could give this place less than one star, I totally would. When we walked in, the wait was snaked all the way from the front desk to the restroom. Normally, you'd put your name in and wait until your name is called; however, this place gives you numbers instead. Therefore, people were standing in line aimlessly. We waited for about an hour or so and then we were finally seated.

The food is sub-par with not that much variety. It looked like it had been sitting on the plate for a long time. Throughout my time at the restaurant, I only saw one plate being changed at the sushi buffet. The non-sushi food was also pretty bad. The crowding in the restaurant only added to the negatives. 

ALSO there was a dead fly on my green tea ice cream. I REPEAT THERE WAS A FLY IN MY ICE CREAM. EW. 

TL/DR: not worth the price, bugs in restaurant, too crowded, don't do.

Although this time I didn't eat crablegs, I had my full share of sashimi. Soon good. Actually ate other stuff. Their Caesar salad was really good. Had julienned carrots and thinly sliced apple. Really good. Suggestion with the sliced sashimi, slice a little thinner and more daikon along the sides of the dish.

I am really caught between a  3-4 stars for this place as I miss the downtown location and this place doesn't seem to have the selection or layout the other one did. However, what they lacked for in selection, they made up for in terms of service. Generally with buffet style establishments, you never see your server other then for a bill or the original drink order. The staff here though are on top of it all. Drinks were promptly refilled and plates cleared after every time we got up. 

While I usually stay away from sushi at these kinds of places, I do trust it during lunch time when it's really busy and they turn it over quite a bit and when they first open as its fresh. Many of the usual standby were still present but I did miss the tempura selection the other location used to offer. Overall though, still a solid place.

Quick tips:

1. Located in a very busy strip mall on Decatur and Flamingo! You might have to park a bit far from this one.

2. You can request hand rolls made to order from the sushi chefs!

3. You can request your ramen spicy!

As promised, this is part of my post-Vegas binge series of reviews. It's a shame that I haven't ever reviewed this place considering that it has been an old favorite of my family for quite a few years now. Since the first time that I was wowed by this place, not a lot has really changed except for my own personal tastes.

The service here is fast, friendly, and efficient. Normally, my family comes very early so there is little to no wait time between getting in and being seated. However, I have noticed that if you are more towards the prime time of dining, you should expect to wait quite awhile to get in.

As for the rest of the staff, I haven't really had many problems either with the waiters and waitresses or the sushi chefs and other cooks. Most requests are met with certainty and the waitress comes often enough that the tables are pretty clean and never really full of dishes.

The food is divided into hot food and sushi. We were just in for dinner last month, so this is a review for the dinner sushi. For dinner, they offer nigiri as well as cuts of sashimi. We noticed that there is quite a bit of rice stuffed under the fish, but at least the raw cuts were nice and fresh. By far a favorite of mine is the salmon skin nigiri and accompanying rolls. 

As you make your way around the sushi area, you'll notice that they have many various types of rolls. I tried most of them except for the deep fried ones because they seemed to be a heart attack waiting to happen. Anyways, the rolls are what are considered common: rice, vegetables, and questionable types of fish covered in some thick sauce. Overall the rolls were fine, though filled a bit with too much rice.

One of the things I always enjoy are their handrolls. They premake the handrolls and leave them out for you to grab on your own; however, if you have a special request for a different type of fish, you can always ask them to make you a custom hand roll.

For the hot food, there are the various normal types of things you would see at a Japanese buffet such as chicken teriyaki, fried rice, calamari, salt-pepper shrimp and the like. They also put out shrimp tempura, veggie tempura, and a delightful ramen station that is made to order. I suggest trying the spicy tonkatsu ramen! They also serve udon around the corner as well as Korean-style galbi short ribs.

For dessert, there is a pretty big selection of cakes, ice cream, frozen yogurt, as well as a chocolate fountain. When we went, however, the chocolate fountain looked like it wasn't as smooth as other places. In fact, after making a chocolate fountain at home, I've sworn off of using them. This is because of the massive amount of oil that goes into making the chocolate run smoothly. I wasn't really impressed with their desserts because the cakes, pastries, and cookies were all run of the mill offerings that you would expect at any Chinese/Japanese buffet.

Overall, this is still one of our favorite spots to stop at because the food is affordable and not insanely priced like most of the rest of the strip. I hope you have a chance to check out Makinos soon!

GREAT Sushi for what you pay.
For the amount of sushi variety you get at this buffet, its an extremely great value. $22 for dinner, 15 for lunch I think.
The sushi may not be the best cuts, but they are fresh and tasty.
Great spot for a group of people/family.
Lots of people go here, but they have plenty of seats.

Great selection.  People were nice. My wife said foods aside from sushi was very authentic and tasty. Sushi was fresh with large pieces of fish. Much more selection of rolls than sushi. HUGE selection of rolls. Only negative is overall restaurant could be cleaner.

This place was almost perfect. My only complaint is waiting 30 minutes with lots of other people when they have closed a third of their seating area. Why do that when it's the middle of your busiest time? But the food was just so good, I'm giving them extra stars for that so that's why 4 stars. I will go back when I come back to Vegas

I enjoyed the glass noodles, maybe the sashimi but mostly their creme brûlée.

I like the idea that it's a sushi buffet, an Asian buffet all in one. I went on a Sunday night, it was quite busy but I digress to say that most of their food were salty and I didn't enjoy myself.. I'm my opinion I think that Makinos is overpriced opposed to the quality of their food, my daughter is 2 and never touched her food but unfortunately because of her height (she's a tall girl, her father is a tall man) I had to pay for her.

I've been to this location 3 different times and unfortunately all experiences were unsatisfactory.

However, the the Las Vegas Outlet location was pretty tasty. I think it's a hit or miss.

We came here on a 114 degree day.  There is not much of a waiting area and there is a lot of people waiting right in the front area.  It's not a big place, but there are so many variety of food.  They have so many different variety of sushi.  They also have made to order ramen and udon.  They constantly pick up your finished plates, so that you won't have a stack of plates at your table.  Drinks are not included.

Based on my last and only experience, this place is the bomb! You get an array of freshly made sushi's.  They even got hot stir-fry items, green tea ice cream and chocolate fountains! I would go back!

This place is great!!! Farrrrr more better than the sushi you find in the buffets on the strip or downtown Vegas. Guess cause its gourmet sushi and seafood buffet & they are committed to serving the finest ingredients and highest quality food. I can't help but to indulge in sensational taste @ the finest Japanese cuisine.  Every time im in Vegas,we visit Makino .  We'll keep coming back! Delicious!!!
Best place in Vegas. Don't even think to go to the casino buffets. Great sushi and seafood selection! Very good service. Coming here every time we in Vegas. Very satisfied. Will be back again!
